original_en_text: Farewell, little pilgrim. May your shell harden the path for others to tread.
original_zh_text: 再见了，朝圣者。你的身体为他人铺平了道路。

original_en_text: Times like this, all we can do is put our heads down and try to rebuild.
original_zh_text: 在这种情况下，我们能做的就是低下头站起来。

original_en_text: <page>Mmmm! Is it time? Our lands shake their sorrow! For the new beat, yes? Demanding! For a new rhythm...<hpage>These quakes you feel, they are not your land’s sadness, they are its collapse, one bound to happen if their source cannot be quelled.<page>What? No, no no... the beat... It is the beat our land wishes! Calls for it! Needs one new!
original_zh_text: &lt;page&gt;哦！哦！是时候到了吗？我们的国家在痛苦中崩溃了！新节奏？实际上？非常需要！新节奏。&lt;hpage&gt;你们正在经历的地震不是你们地球的苦难，而是地球的破坏，如果地球的根源不融化，这种破坏就不可避免地发生。&lt;page&gt;这是什么？不不

original_en_text: Head quick for that vein of bells, and find my uncle hidden there. If anyone’s able to point you to a cure for that thing twisting within your shell, it’ll be him.
original_zh_text: 当我走近门铃时，叔叔离开了。如果有人能教你如何治疗身体扭曲，那就是这个人。

original_en_text: Mmm! Mmm. Who are you, little you? Not a wish granter. For you haven’t enough fruits. Three we need, three I need! Find them, find them!
original_zh_text: 哦！哦！我的天啊！“你是谁，儿子？这不是一个有希望的想法，因为我们没有足够的水果。你需要三个！我找到他了，我找到他了！

original_en_text: Ah! Here she is, safe after all! I was worried your battle with that enormous beast had left you badly wounded.<page>Shames me to have left you in danger there, missy, but I’m no warrior, and my tools ain’t no match for a creature like that.<hpage>It is well that you kept yourself safe. This settlement needs a fixer now, not a warrior.<page>Heh, maybe that’s true. Times like these all we can do is put our heads down and try to rebuild.
original_zh_text: 是的，正确的。哦，是的！“你在这里会很安全。&lt;page&gt;“女士，我很羞于将您置于危险之中，但我不是士兵，我的工具无法抵抗这个生物。" "&lt;hpage&gt;确保自己的安全是件好事，但这个决定需要仲裁者，而不是战士。"&lt;page&gt;在这种情况下，我们能做的就是低下头站起来。

original_en_text: Rest here with us, long as you like. Mightn’t be much time left, but at least we few won’t have to face that fate alone.
original_zh_text: 时间可能很短，但至少我们中的一些人不必独自面对这种命运。

original_en_text: Ah! Glad I caught you for a moment, miss. You’ve done a fair service to this camp, given much more’n most.<page>I’d been thinkin’ on all your efforts, and set to making a little something to repay ‘em.<page>S’only a token, really! But I’ve put all me talent into it, much as I’ve got! Something to keep you company on the lonely roads above.<page>Hold onto it on your travels, and remember that you’re always welcome down here with us.
original_zh_text: 是的，正确的。哦，是的！“很高兴认识你，女士。在这件事上你比我公平。&lt;page&gt;我同情你的努力，并愿意做一些事情来奖励你。&lt;page&gt;这只是一个象征，你知道。我尽力了，我尽力了！孤独的路上有东西&lt;page&gt;我们欢迎您旅途中的每一刻。

original_en_text: <hpage>This camp seems in poor condition, good bug. With the lands around turning deadly, I’d worry for its safety.<page>Aye. We surely aren’t seeing its finest moment, but this place has been serving us passing bugs for as long as any can remember.<page>It’s faith, you see! All those pilgrims, now and past. Our devotion holds it together. The camp’ll remain, and provide, no matter the troubles.<page>
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;土壤很糟糕，昆虫也很糟糕。我担心你的安全，因为你周围的地球可能是致命的。&lt;page&gt;当然，我们还没有见过更好的时刻，但只要有人记得，这个地方就以错误的方式服务于我们。&lt;page&gt;朝圣者是现在和过去的人。我们的承诺将他们团结在一起。&lt;page&gt;

original_en_text: <hpage>What ritual calls you all together, pilgrim?<page>Our brother, this poor wretch in my arms, has walked his last aching step. We gather here to sing him farewell, and to mourn our great loss.
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;亲爱的朝圣者们，你们正在举行什么仪式？&lt;page&gt;我可怜的兄弟在我怀里，痛苦地迈出了最后一步。

original_en_text: If the veiled bugs have an interest in you, enough to brave the wastes beyond our borders, then you must be rather special, yes?<hpage>In my own lands, some may once have seen me so. In this place, with my strength sapped, I am just another traveller.<page>Ohho! A traveller, but still something more. I can see it now. Of course! That focus!<page>Did those veiled bugs realise who they snared? Perhaps it is they who should be worried, eh?
original_zh_text: 如果锅炉虫是你的，你有勇气越境，你就必须很特别。&lt;hpage&gt;在我的国家，我的力量正在减弱，我只是一个旅行者，也许有人看到了。&lt;page&gt;是的，大喊！旅行者等。我已经见过他了！“这个方法！&lt;page&gt;谁把伪装的昆虫关进了监狱？我应该担心他们吗？

original_en_text: My wish. Oh my wish! I need fruits of the world, three little darlings. I need them! Does the kingdom not send you, little you, to grant my desire?
original_zh_text: 我的愿望，我的愿望，我需要世界的果实，我需要三个儿子，国王会派你来完成我的愿望。

original_en_text: Ahh, awake at last! You should mind your strength, traveller. There’s no use wasting energy on an old nobody like me.<hpage>I see that now, madam. My welcome to your land has not been kind. I had reason to be wary.
original_zh_text: 你终于醒了！旅行者必须注意自己的优势。你不需要像我这样匿名的人来浪费你的精力。&lt;hpage&gt;“我们来到你的土地，必须小心。

original_en_text: Up with you! Up! I won’t have you dying on my floor!
original_zh_text: 跟随你和我！醒醒！我不会让你死在我的土地上。"

original_en_text: <hpage>I am no pilgrim. I am Hornet, and I arrive in your land by no choice of my own.<hpage>I was brought to your kingdom by force, captured by strange bugs clad in veils.<page>Oho! How curious! The bugs of the Citadel, at the summit of our land. They veil themselves in service to their faith, or perhaps as slaves to something greater...<hpage>Then I shall seek their Citadel. If the veiled bugs would go to such lengths to bring me here, I intend to find out why.<page>Oho! Ferocious! Intimidating! Yours is no pilgrim’s spirit! You’ve the bearing of a hunter.<page>Welcome then, fierce traveller, to Pharloom! Our holy yet haunted land.<page>Before you depart, permit an old bug a brief warning. Best keep that weapon drawn.<page>Our kingdom is gripped by a curse. Its paths grow wild and dangerous, and though some still attempt the climb to the Citadel at its crest, none return to speak of what they see.
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;我不是朝圣者，我是朝圣者，我别无选择，只能来到你们的国家。&lt;hpage&gt;我被强行拖进他的王国，被一只戴着面纱的奇怪昆虫抓住。&lt;page&gt;我的天啊！多么好奇啊！城堡的昆虫在地上，他们需要信仰，可能是更伟大的东西的奴隶。&lt;hpage&gt;如果这些隐藏的错误让我走了这么远，找出原因。&lt;page&gt;我的天啊！我非常专注！他威胁你！他的心不是朝圣者的心，而是猎人的心。&lt;page&gt;欢迎来到灯笼，强大的旅行者！这是一个神圣的地方，但它是一个鬼魂。&lt;page&gt;离开前请给我一个简短的警告。&lt;page&gt;我们的王国被诅咒包围，街道变得狂野而危险，有些人试图爬上城堡的顶部，但没有人谈论他们所看到的。

original_en_text: So you’re another pilgrim then? Scuttled out of the darkness to climb the great path and bow at its gilded peak?
original_zh_text: 你是朝圣者吗？在黑暗中挖掘，走上街头，倚着金山？

original_en_text: Well, look at that! You’ve gone and donated all those shell shards, just like I wished for! I can scarcely believe it!<page>Those shards are valuable, alright. Brilliant for crafting and fixing, very versatile.<page>More than that, though... it was a warm thing you did, the sort of kindness you don’t see much in this weary place.<hpage>Was this kindness? I must take care to learn of this land and claim what advantage I can from it. Answering requests like yours can often fit those ends.<page>Oh, it’s like that, is it? Well, even still, the help’s well appreciated, miss. Best of luck in your travels, and may every wish of yours be granted!
original_zh_text: 我有所有的子弹，我想让你看看这个！这太不可思议了！&lt;page&gt;它们非常适合生产和维护，可用于各种应用。&lt;page&gt;然而，这并不是唯一的事情。你正在做的事情是一件温暖而美妙的事情，在这个疲惫的地方很难找到。&lt;hpage&gt;诚实？我们必须认真了解这片土地并从中受益。&lt;page&gt;“是的，是的，是的。“谢谢你的帮助，女孩。祝您旅途愉快，您所有的愿望都会实现！

original_en_text: Oh, oh dear... what fearful events are sent to test we poor pilgrims! How could it be that our path to paradise is infested with such beasts?<page>To brave such a world... oh my. I’ll need more rosaries, that’s for certain. Please traveller, won’t you trade with me?
original_zh_text: “是的，亲爱的，贫穷朝圣者的生活会很可怕。"&lt;page&gt;在世界面前勇敢一点--哦，我肯定需要更多的念珠书。现在你是一名旅行者。你不和我做生意吗？"

original_en_text: You are my wish granter, yes? My wish! I need fruits of the world, three little darlings. I need them, so I wish!<page>You made the promise. A binding stronger than sin. Bring me the three Mossberries. Precious fruit! Grant my wish, and then the work begins!
original_zh_text: 你实现了我的愿望，不是吗？我的愿望！需要三个孩子才能收获世界的果实。&lt;page&gt;我向你保证，这是一个比罪更强大的约。给我三个缪斯女神，一颗珍贵的果实。您的愿望实现了，工作已经开始！

original_en_text: I’ve a long way to go, and much more to see. For now though, let’s just rest a little while, eh?
original_zh_text: 我们还有很长的路要走，还有很多东西要看，但让我们休息吧。

original_en_text: Times are hard, so fresh supplies are always welcome! Bugs arrive here with nothin’ and often leave without much more.
original_zh_text: 天气恶劣，但新鲜感总是受欢迎的。这个错误什么也没有，当它消失时，什么也没有。

original_en_text: Well now! Seems I’ve traded you the last of my supplies, so I’ve got no more excuses to linger down here.<page>I’ll soon be making my way up to the great Citadel. As holy as I am with rosaries, I’m sure my path will not be an arduous one...
original_zh_text: 我没事，我没事！好吧，好吧！好的！这里没有任何借口，就好像你在交换最后的供应一样。&lt;page&gt;虽然我是念珠圣人，但我相信我的旅程不会很困难。

original_en_text: Bring more Mossberries here. Mmm. Yes, we will trade. Precious rosaries for fresh berries! Seek them wherever you see the green moss grow!
original_zh_text: 请给我一块慕斯。好吧，我们做个交易。美丽的玫瑰和新鲜的浆果！即使您看到绿蝇生长，也要尝试一下。

original_en_text: You bear your blade well, hunter, and you’ve skill, no doubt, so I don’t mean any unkindness when I say you still seem a little frail.<hpage>I was a long time spent captive, bound by seals strange to me. My strength is diminished, but recoverable.<hpage>By the time I reach that Citadel, I’ll be ready to face what waits.
original_zh_text: 猎人，你的剑术很好。你当然有技能。表现得软弱是没有用的。&lt;hpage&gt;很长一段时间，我被困在一个奇怪的陷阱里，失去了力量，但我设法恢复了过来。&lt;hpage&gt;当我到达城堡时，我已经为即将发生的事情做好了准备。

original_en_text: Oh! Hunter, aren’t you in a sorry state? You’re all bound up, looking worse than when we first met!<hpage>My shell has become host to a cruel parasite. Though my natural strength keeps it from consuming me entirely, I’m much weakened by its presence.<page>Well, this just won’t do! Pharloom’s already in the snare of one fell curse, we can’t have another vying to leech what life remains.<page>Best you head quick over to that town of bells, at the core of our kingdom. I’ve an uncle hidden about there, an old hermit, and a horrid curmudgeon.<page>That hermit’s a hard one to befriend, but he holds some knowledge about this kingdom’s maladies. If anyone’s able to point you to a cure, it’ll be him.
original_zh_text: 我的天啊！“你高兴吗，亨特？你受到攻击了，你看起来比我们见面时更糟糕！&lt;hpage&gt;我与生俱来的力量并没有完全消耗我。&lt;page&gt;它不工作！“法老被困在腐败的诅咒之下，一生都无法与他人竞争。&lt;page&gt;他们逃到了我们王国中心的贝尔，在那里我有一个隐藏的叔叔，一个老人，粗鲁而可怕。&lt;page&gt;隐士很难结交朋友，但他了解王国的邪恶。如果有人能告诉你什么是治疗，那就是你。

original_en_text: Mmm, the precious fruit! And... oh! Such fruit! Perfectly ripe! Perfectly fragrant! Perfectly round! Take what you have earned, much of much rosaries!
original_zh_text: 珍贵的水果和.哦！哦！哦！哦！这个水果！他们完全准备好了！这里，闻闻！充分利用你赚的钱！

original_en_text: O-oh! Traveller! Won’t you stop and make trade with an old pilgrim? Surely something here will aid you in your great journey!
original_zh_text: 我的天啊！旅行者！为什么不停止与古代朝圣者签订条约呢？住在这里一定会对您的旅行有用！

original_en_text: You keep the fruit for yourself? For greed? Strange choice! It will only weigh you down...
original_zh_text: 你想要一些水果吗？是因为贪婪吗？多么奇怪的选择啊！这会让你感到沉重。

original_en_text: Don’t go thinkin’ fear’s keepin’ me from my own pilgrimage! S’just there’s a lotta work still to do here and few bugs able to do it.
original_zh_text: 请不要认为恐惧会阻碍我的朝圣之旅。“你能做的事情很多，但你能做的事情却很少。

original_en_text: Sing for our brother, who has died a devout death! All his pains and torments left behind, like the dust shrugged from a traveller’s shawl.
original_zh_text: 他所有的痛苦和考验都已过去，就像旅行者衣服上的灰尘一样。

original_en_text: Promised, then. A binding stronger than sin. Bring me the three Mossberries. Precious fruit! Grant my wish, and then the work begins!
original_zh_text: 这是一种比罪恶更强大的纽带。给我三个缪斯！多么珍贵的水果啊！您的愿望实现了，工作已经开始！

original_en_text: Mm. Mmm! Who is it? An intruder! Terrible! To interrupt a humble druid as they work!<hpage>I meant no intrusion, druid. The sound of your laughter drew me to investigate.<hpage>This settlement is built around an old structure of the Weavers. Do you know of them? Do they inhabit this land still?<page>Mm? What settlement? What Weavers?! You speak nonsense!
original_zh_text: 我的天啊！对，对！“你是谁？入侵！可怕的是，不起眼的机器人的工作已经停止了！&lt;hpage&gt;机器人不想干扰他的笑声，并要求我调查一下。&lt;hpage&gt;该殖民地是围绕托加乔夫家族的老建筑而建的。你明白了吗？他们还活着在地球上吗？&lt;page&gt;这是什么？你在干什么？和解？什么样的缝纫机？你太荒谬了！“

original_en_text: <hpage>Madam, I return seeking power to aid the construction of a trap, at request of your sibling residing atop the Citadel.<page>Aye, hunter. So you managed to rouse the old fool. I’ve known it coming, felt it, and glad I am! <page>Rest’a my family spent far too long huddled and glum... or dead! Not me! I’d always been thinkin’ it a waste to just take what’s coming, when her up top wakes.<page>Better to fight for freedom or go out in a blaze, oh ho!
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;应住在城堡顶上的兄弟姐妹的要求，我再次请求他们帮助建造电子陷阱。&lt;page&gt;我像个傻瓜一样醒来，我知道发生了什么，我很高兴。&lt;page&gt;我们一家人在一起很长时间了，她很不高兴。不，这是我！我不认为接受醒来后发生的事有什么用。&lt;page&gt;你是为自由而战，还是为自由而战？

original_en_text: Mmm, the precious fruit! Ah... but! This one is not so fresh. Rotten! Stench of death! A meagre amount of rosaries for you. As much as you deserve!
original_zh_text: 水果，也许吧。这不是新鲜的，肮脏的混蛋，太臭了！这是一个做你必须做的事情的小地方！

original_en_text: Once this wishwall is up, bugs’ll be able to seek help from any able shell around. You could even try granting a couple of wishes yourself, missy!
original_zh_text: 一旦欲望之墙建立起来，昆虫就可以依靠贝壳寻求帮助。

original_en_text: Rest here with me as long as you like. I’m not ready to leave yet, and a little company is always nice.
original_zh_text: 您可以在这里放松身心。“我还没有准备好，亲爱的朋友，这总是一件好事。"

original_en_text: Down here, you can’t hear the cries of the pilgrims above, only the faintly ringing bells. I’ll stay and meditate a little longer, before I start my own pilgrimage...
original_zh_text: 在这里，你听不到朝圣者的哭声，只有微弱的钟声。我沉思了一会儿，开始了我的朝圣之旅。"

original_en_text: Farewell, brother Pilby. May your shell harden the path for others to tread.
original_zh_text: 再见，菲尔比兄弟，你的身体将为他人铺平道路。

original_en_text: ...Hm. Who here knows the name of this little pilgrim?
original_zh_text: ...¿有人知道这个蛋糕的名字吗？

original_en_text: Common stuff, shell shards, but very practical. I can use ‘em to patch almost anything up, and this camp’s always in need of some mending.
original_zh_text: 这是一个常见的问题，这是一个壳中的壳，但它非常实用。其实一切都可以修复，但这个区域必须修复。

original_en_text: And another poor pilgrim lost, eh? Just the thought of it makes me weary. Better to put my head down and work ‘til the job’s done...
original_zh_text: 我厌倦了想这个，所以最好低着头，努力工作到最后。

original_en_text: Hm? A fellow pilgrim, are you? About to start your great journey to the holy Citadel up top?<hpage>I am no pilgrim, sir, though it seems we will be travelling a similar path.<page>Not a pilgrim? Well, it makes no difference, I suppose. We all must walk the roads, up and up, though most of us will fall long before we see the grand gates.<page>If you’re wise, you’ll stop here and rest a while before heading out into that dangerous world...
original_zh_text: 这是什么？你在干什么？你是朝圣者吗？实际上？准备好进入圣城了吗？&lt;hpage&gt;虽然我不是朝圣者，但我认为我们正在走上类似的道路。&lt;page&gt;你不是朝圣者吗？“我们都必须沿着这条路走，但大多数人在看到美丽的大门之前就摔倒了。&lt;page&gt;如果你聪明，就在这里停下来休息，进入这个危险的世界。

original_en_text: And for the parting, a gift. An amulet of we druids. Or me druid? No others, I think.<page>May it ease your sorrows, wish granter. May it cry for you when no tears are left!
original_zh_text: 在我们说再见之前，我有另一个礼物，一个机器人护身符。我是机器人吗？我想没有其他人了。&lt;page&gt;“你很幸福。减轻你的痛苦和你在一起。当我没有眼泪的时候，让我为你哭泣。

original_en_text: Mmm! Mmm! You carry a sweet, precious smell with you. A fruit! Will you trade it for rosaries?
original_zh_text: 哦！哦！哦，哦！它给你一种甜美而珍贵的香味。水果！为什么不取代罗杰？

original_en_text: <hpage>I wonder, little pilgrim. What calls you and your fellows up to the Citadel? If the way is dangerous, why take the journey at all?<page>Strange question to be asking of a pilgrim. Our holy land calls on us. To journey up is our greatest task. Who are we to refuse?<page>Guided by faith, we climb through flaming fields, across rolling moors, and up great gilded steps. All to reach that eternal, shining Citadel.<page>Once I’m good and ready, I’ll make the climb myself...
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;“年轻的朝圣者，你和你的朋友们来到城堡做了什么？“如果这条路很危险，为什么要走这条路呢？”&lt;page&gt;圣地正在召唤我们。旅游业是我们的主要活动。谁有权拒绝？&lt;page&gt;在信仰的指引下，我们爬上了火、旋转的山谷和雄伟的金色楼梯。&lt;page&gt;当你准备好后，你就自己去。

original_en_text: Mmm. Mmm! The pain... my mind aches. Why? The berries, the nasty fruits. Oh the visions!<page>You, wish promiser. Wish granter. You brought me what I needed and stayed by my side. Companion through my ordeal. I could ask for nothing more.
original_zh_text: 我的天啊！对，对！“痛苦是. ...“我的心很痛，为什么？贝尔文，无聊的水果。我的愿景！&lt;page&gt;他们为我提供了我需要的一切，而且他们总是在我身边。

original_en_text: Ahhh! Ahhh-ohhhh! The smell is right! Like the others! But very young! Oh, voice of the woods! Oh, dance of the queen! Oh... oh! Beat harder, let us hear it! Oh! Ohhhhhhhh!
original_zh_text: 是的，正确的。哦，是的！哦，是的！哦，是的！味道更好！就像其他人一样！该死，伙计们！森林的噪音！女王之舞！哦，是的！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！如果你推，你就会感觉到。哦，是的！

original_en_text: Sing, brothers and sisters! Sing, and drown out this burdensome sorrow! Sing out the name of this poor pilgrim, whose journey had nary begun!
original_zh_text: 兄弟们，唱歌！如果你喝了它，它会伤害你。他唱出了尚未开始旅程的贫穷朝圣者的名字。

original_en_text: Have you heard the talk of what waits just beyond this camp?<page>Brittle caverns of bone, the very base of Pharloom, filled with all manner of deadly creatures and jagged dangers.<page>It’s said ancient bugs once made their homes amidst it.<page>Who could believe! In such a hostile, unstable place! In all my time, I’ve never met a bug so brave.
original_zh_text: 你听说他们在营地外等什么了吗？&lt;page&gt;农场地板上一个脆弱的骨洞里充满了致命的生物和危险。&lt;page&gt;据推测，古代昆虫曾经生活在这里。&lt;page&gt;谁可以信任我们？在如此不稳定、不稳定的地方，我从未遇到过如此勇敢的昆虫。

original_en_text: Sister, sister! What is that long, gleaming tooth you carry with you? Is it a weapon?<hpage>It is indeed, though you need not fear. I will not raise it against you. Its edge is meant for predators and other foes.<hpage>I strongly suggest you arm yourself similarly before your own journey begins.<page>Alas... for a pilgrim, that’s sin you speak of, sister.<page>We arm ourselves with prayer, garb ourselves in faith, and hope they prove enough to reach the Citadel’s glory. Such is our way...
original_zh_text: 姐姐！姐姐！“你的牙齿怎么样了？这是武器吗？&lt;hpage&gt;是的，但这并不意味着我们应该害怕。它将帮助您对抗掠食者和其他敌人。&lt;hpage&gt;我们强烈建议您在出发前以同样的方式武装自己。&lt;page&gt;是的，正确的。“这就是他所说的犯罪。&lt;page&gt;我们可以用祈祷武装自己，用信仰打扮自己，我们可以为这座城市的荣耀做好准备。

original_en_text: Oh! Back again? The wishwall is up! Ready for all the poor souls who’ve been left behind down here.<page>In Pharloom, wishes are granted to those truly devout, or so they say. And there ain’t no harm in us dregs having wishes too.<page>Why, I even went and added a little wish of my own to the wishwall! Fair’s fair. I did build the thing. Seems like the kingdom should be granting my wish before anyone else’s.
original_zh_text: 哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！你回来了吗？愿望之墙正在增长，为穷人做好准备。&lt;page&gt;愿望是那些与真正优秀的人交谈的人，喜欢或讨厌我们的东西。&lt;page&gt;我把我的小愿望贴在墙上。“正义就是正义，我做到了，王国似乎也满足了我的愿望。" "

original_en_text: <hpage>What’s this you’re building, sir? A sign of some kind?<page>Aye, aye. You’re a sharp bug! A wishwall. It’s past time this old camp had one. As the resident fixer, I’ve taken it upon myself to sort it out.<page>They’re a popular thing about Pharloom, wishwalls. Useful too. So many prayers left unanswered. Gives ‘em a place to go.
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;你在干什么？这些症状是什么？&lt;page&gt;你是一只活生生的昆虫，一堵欲望之墙。在这个古老的地方，有一个人，作为专业人士，有责任解决这个问题。&lt;page&gt;法勒姆的“愿望墙”--许多祈祷都没有得到回应。

original_en_text: I must listen carefully... and pray with uninterrupted devotion. Only then will my faith be strong enough... to carry me upward...
original_zh_text: 祈祷它永远不会结束。我的信心更强了。“他接受他们。"

original_en_text: S’not a surprise it’s you rallying us to action, hunter. You had the sense about you, a bug bringing change’n all.<page>Course you’re more than just a bug, aint’cha! More than Weaver. Guess it’d take someone like you for my family to dare hope at success.<page>Go and prove our trust now, won’t you? We’ve spent our lifetimes wishing for another path. With a bit of luck, you might grant it.
original_zh_text: 他们觉得自己犯了导致改变的错误。&lt;page&gt;你不就是个奶奶吗？实际上？似乎只有像你这样的人才能为我们家的成功祈祷，但我不知道这是不是真的。&lt;page&gt;我们都想要一条不同的道路，如果我们幸运的话，我们可以做到。

original_en_text: Well. Though this pilgrim’s name has been lost, still we sing.
original_zh_text: 一切都很好，一切都很好，即使朝圣者的名字消失了，我们也会继续唱歌。

original_en_text: Been hearing awful whispers in camp, about pilgrims driven mad by the hardships of the climb, crying out and attacking their fellows.<page>You’ve been out there. Tell me, is it really so?<hpage>You’ve heard it true, sir. On the roads, both pilgrims and beasts alike are consumed, driven to violence by a haunted thread, the source of which I have yet to discover.<page>Ah... I’d feared it was so. I won’t be able to trust a single face out on the path, then.<page>The risk of death was daunting enough, but the loneliness of such a journey, that seems almost too much to bear... Ah well. Just another test of our devotion, I suppose.
original_zh_text: 在营地内，我听到朝圣者可怕的声音，他们因攀登困难和同伴受到袭击而哭泣。&lt;page&gt;“你在这里，告诉我，他真的在这里吗？&lt;hpage&gt;沿途的朝圣者和动物吸收了有关鬼魂的线索并参与了暴力行为，但它们的起源仍然未知。&lt;page&gt;是的，正确的。我简直不敢相信街上的面孔。&lt;page&gt;死亡的危险是可怕的，但这样的旅程的孤独似乎几乎难以忍受。

original_en_text: We pilgrims arm ourselves with prayer, garb ourselves in faith, and hope they prove enough to reach the Citadel’s glory. Such is our way...
original_zh_text: 我们这些朝圣者，以祈祷为武器，以信仰为衣，足以享受这座城市的荣耀。

original_en_text: <hpage>What duty binds you to this old chapel, madam? The structure barely stands, and I see no signs of congregation.<page>Aye! Gone! The lot’o them, fled and hidden. But I’m not leaving till I’ve set this place right...<page>...It’s that Citadel above, you see. Even now, in Pharloom’s long decline, the simple bugs, they’re witless before it. Too grand. Too majestic. Too powerful.<page>This building’s state is a sad example of those who’d dare suggest another path...
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;你对旧教会负有什么责任？大楼几乎就在那里，没有会议的迹象。&lt;page&gt;哦，是的！哦，是的！你必须离开！许多人已经逃跑躲藏起来，但在我清理这个地方之前，我不会离开。&lt;page&gt;...在棕榈树的长期衰落中，即使是现在，这些简单的错误在过去也是愚蠢的。&lt;page&gt;对于那些敢于提出另一条道路的人来说，建筑物的状况是一个悲伤的例子。

original_en_text: Eh? What fortune is this? Our wish answered, even in a moment so dark!<page>You’ve proved quite the saviour, miss, and you’ve certainly earned the appreciation of this whole sorry lot.<hpage>You are welcome, sir. For you few, I hope these supplies may aid.
original_zh_text: 这是什么？你在干什么？这是什么财富？即使在这些空虚的日子里，我们的愿望也实现了。&lt;page&gt;你已经向我们表明你是救主，你已经从穷人那里得到了赞美。&lt;hpage&gt;欢迎来到博士。我希望这本书对很多人有帮助。

original_en_text: You, in the cloak... pray tread softly. I am meditating, gathering my faith... before my pilgrimage begins.<hpage>My steps are soft enough, madam. If I have disturbed you, it was not my intent.<page>Ahh... even your speech... far too loud. I can scarcely hear my thoughts. Please, be away...
original_zh_text: 穿上斗篷，安静地祈祷。通过冥想可以获得信心。在朝圣开始之前。&lt;hpage&gt;我的脚很软，小姐，如果你打断我，那不是我的本意。&lt;page&gt;是的，正确的。她的演讲也是如此，声音太大了，我几乎听不见自己的想法。

original_en_text: I see you’ve gone and opened up the great bone gate back there. And without even asking my permission! Feeling curious, were you?<hpage>There is a vast grave beyond. I’d assumed most bugs died climbing the path, but it seems many fell before their trek had barely commenced.<page>Aye! Lost their lives to beasts, or to luck turned rotten. Others were simply formed too frail.<page>At least those poor souls can rest together. Death and death and death, the eternal promise of our eternal kingdom. Eventually, it claims us all.
original_zh_text: 我看到他打开一扇大骨门走出来，很有趣，不是吗？实际上？&lt;hpage&gt;当我沿着小路走时，大多数昆虫都会死去，但其中许多似乎在徒步旅行开始之前就已经掉下来了。&lt;page&gt;哦，是的！哦，是的！他们的生命被动物夺走或被命运摧毁。对方的形象非常脆弱。&lt;page&gt;至少，可怜的灵魂可以睡在一起。死亡是我们永恒王国的承诺。

original_en_text: Hunter! I’m thinking it was you that cleared my basement?<hpage>On first arrival here, the nesting creatures didn’t take kindly to my passing.<page>Ohho. They’re cranky bugs, alright. And they made an awful mess down here with their hatching and breeding.<page>You’ve my many thanks for seeing them off!
original_zh_text: 猎人也是如此。你打扫地下室了吗？&lt;hpage&gt;当我第一次来到这里时，巢穴里的生物对我的死不感兴趣。&lt;page&gt;不不&lt;page&gt;谢谢你送我来这里！"

original_en_text: <hpage>The bugs of your land, I have watched them, climbing towards their absolution without the flicker of a thought to what it means.<page>Aye. But isn’t it always such for those snared to serve your higher caste?<page>Our mortal mob did once act some defiance, unawares maybe, but successful in part, goaded towards it by Weavers’ will’n all.<hpage>You speak of the Citadel? Its former function has failed, but I can still sense its purpose, some. It is church and cage both.<page>Aye. Devised by your ancestors that monstrosity, and their wicked, clever minds. A system, or a web they’d likely call it, a way to keep their mother sealed in slumber, and themselves free to lavish in their false rule.
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;“我看到你们土地上的昆虫乞求原谅，但我不知道这意味着什么。&lt;page&gt;但这正是所有在高种姓服役的人所做的。&lt;page&gt;强盗们不知不觉地抵抗了，但凭借韦弗的意志和所有的动力，他们成功了。&lt;hpage&gt;你在说名字吗？即使之前的职能没有成功，目标仍然可以被感知。这是教堂，这是教堂。&lt;page&gt;他们的祖先创造了怪物、邪恶、聪明的灵魂，我们可以称之为系统或网络，这是一种让母亲入睡并按照错误的规则度过空闲时间的方式。

original_en_text: <hpage>Maker, I bring a delivery from Bellhart below, lacquer for your long work.<page>Ahh. Know you distort the order of things, Old One. It is a rare want of your caste to serve us mortal bugs.<hpage>I am not my kin, Maker. I have seen enough pain born of their dominion. As much as I may, I choose to stand apart.<page>If your blood allows it so... And my thanks still for the lacquer. Pharloom’s fresh faces will welcome its sheen.
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;制造商先生，我从贝尔巴特派您来为您的长期工作提供墨水。&lt;page&gt;“我知道你违反了命令。提供蠕虫是课堂上难得的愿望。&lt;hpage&gt;我不是父亲或创造者。我们已经看到了你们政权造成的痛苦。&lt;page&gt;只要我的血液允许，我就喜欢绘画。一张新面孔在灯光下闪闪发光。

original_en_text: Until cavern’s collapse, the masks must be made!
Enough talk, Old One. My contract remains. I’ll work till caverns’ collapse.<hpage>Very well, Maker. If it is within my power to do so, I shall see your lands saved.
original_zh_text: 我的合同仍然有效，我将继续工作直到洞穴倒塌。&lt;hpage&gt;太好了，制造商，如果我能做到这一点，我就能拯救你们的国家。"

original_en_text: Ahh. Old One. Your kind should know it’s rude to expose me such. Unmasked, the task becomes heavy. <hpage>I had the desire to hear you lucid, Maker, though you may protest.<page>Aye. Well its no great shock to have you visit. I’ve felt the stirrings of our monarch, even all the way out here, the tremors of her kin brought close.<page>You’re planning a confrontation with her then? The one atop? Our great, frayed god?<hpage>Our meeting seems inevitable, though first I seek the strength to ensure a favourable outcome.<page>Ha! As I’d have guessed! Your ancient kind aren’t told to abide one another peaceably.<page>Well, assuming you prevail, I’ll ask only that my labour may continue. No matter the state of these lands, you should well know the necessity of my service.
original_zh_text: 哎呀，老头，像你这样的人应该知道我是多么无礼地暴露自己。一旦面纱被撕破，任务就会变得困难。&lt;hpage&gt;我可以抗议，但我想听到你清晰的声音，创造者。&lt;page&gt;尽管父母的恐惧越来越近，但我能感受到我们君主的兴奋。&lt;page&gt;你在和她争论吗？你想上来吗？上帝又累又累。&lt;hpage&gt;谈判似乎不可避免，但首先，我们找到了取得有利结果的力量。&lt;page&gt;哦！哦！正如我想象的那样！老年人不被邀请过平静的生活。&lt;page&gt;如果我赢了，无论地球上的条件如何，我都会继续工作。

original_en_text: Back again, Old One? The effects of your... altercation with the pale mother... those are plainly sensed. The fate for these caverns feels grim.<page>I’ll take it things have taken a turn more complicated? Or was this the aftermath anticipated all along?<hpage>In our meeting, a mortal blow was dealt, but the monarch’s desperate death throes now threaten to take this whole kingdom with her.<page>Ha! I’m not surprised! It’s always the way, aye? Your ancient kind, vying for dominion, and us mortal bugs squashed unseen underneath.<hpage>It was freedom I sought, Maker. Naive perhaps, but this is not the fate I wished to come.
original_zh_text: “你回来了，老头？”“当然，流感太苍白了，我不得不和妈妈一起战斗。"&lt;page&gt;你认为事情会变得越来越复杂吗？或者这就是我们所期望的？&lt;hpage&gt;会议期间我们遭受了致命的打击，但君主去世的绝望悲伤却威胁着整个王国。&lt;page&gt;哦！哦！我并不惊讶！一直都是这样的，不是吗？你在干什么？随着古代物种争夺主导地位，人类昆虫正在被赶出人们的视野。&lt;hpage&gt;这就是我寻求的自由，创造者。我知道这听起来可能很天真，但这不是我想要的命运。

original_en_text: All deserve a face. A chance to be! Until I wither, for the faceless I shall provide.
original_zh_text: 每个人都有一张脸，一张脸，一张死了的脸。

original_en_text: To exist, to die, a face is needed. It is the essential thing.
original_zh_text: 我们需要一张脸才能生存，这才是最重要的。

original_en_text: <hpage>Maker, I bring a delivery from Bellhart below, lacquer for your long work. <page>Good! Good! To seal. To protect. May Pharloom’s fresh faces gleam bright.
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;制造商先生，我从贝尔巴特派您来为您的长期工作提供墨水。&lt;page&gt;我没事，我没事！好吧，好吧！好的！由于保护原因关闭，梅·法罗的新面孔闪闪发光。

original_en_text: Take reward for service made, visitor! Gift for you, to spend or treasure!
original_zh_text: 游客将因所提供的服务获得补偿。礼物值得使用或应得！

original_en_text: A visitor! Grand you are. But you have already a mask. Already a face. It is for those without that I must carve.
original_zh_text: 访客！你很好，但你戴着口罩。我已经有脸了。

original_en_text: To work! To work! The masks must be carved.
original_zh_text: 让他工作！去上班吧！面具将被雕刻。

original_en_text: Did you treat with the creature upon the summit?<page>Your legged ancestors once found her company compelling, enough to build their chambers and their calling device at the height of this perilous peak.<hpage>I have paid my respects, and been granted her favour. Her down now fills my cloak, and does much to ward against the frost of these heights.<page>To pass something so precious... That’s a mighty gift you’ve been given. Seems she’s thrown her lot in with you.<page>I’d not have guessed her so opposed to our threaded monarch, but then she too must have sensed the wretched state of things, and the harsher change to come.
original_zh_text: 你见过山上的生物吗？&lt;page&gt;他的祖先在这座危险的山上发现了公司大楼和电话设备房间的魅力。&lt;hpage&gt;它的羽毛布满了我的外套，帮助我抵御如此高的冰。&lt;page&gt;放弃珍贵的东西是你将收到的一份强大的礼物，她似乎已经把自己的命运交给了他。&lt;page&gt;我没想到她会这么大声地谈论我们该死的君主，但我感受到了贫困和不可避免的更深层次的变化。

original_en_text: Ahh. Old One. Your kind should know it’s rude to expose me such. Unmasked, the task becomes heavy. <hpage>I had the desire to hear you lucid, Maker, though you may protest.<page>Aye. Well its no great shock to have you visit. I’ve felt, and heard, the effects of your... altercation with the pale mother... The fate for these caverns seems grim.<page>I’ll take it things have taken a turn more complicated? Or was this the aftermath anticipated all along?<hpage>In our meeting, a mortal blow was dealt, but the monarch’s desperate death throes now threaten to take this whole kingdom with her.<page>Ha! I’m not surprised! It’s always the way, aye? Your ancient kind, vying for dominion, and us mortal bugs squashed unseen underneath.<hpage>It was freedom I sought, Maker, for myself and for you mortal few. Naive perhaps, but this is not the fate I wished to come.
original_zh_text: 古老的东西。你知道我有多粗鲁吗？“当面纱被撕破时，事情就会变得更加困难。&lt;hpage&gt;我可以抗议，但我想听到你清晰的声音，创造者。&lt;page&gt;难怪你在这里。您已经感受到了它的影响。洞穴的命运似乎很沉重：与一位无辜的母亲作斗争。&lt;page&gt;你认为事情会变得越来越复杂吗？或者这就是我们所期望的？&lt;hpage&gt;会议期间我们遭受了致命的打击，但君主去世的绝望悲伤却威胁着整个王国。&lt;page&gt;哦！哦！我并不惊讶！一直都是这样的，不是吗？你在干什么？随着古代物种争夺主导地位，人类昆虫正在被赶出人们的视野。&lt;hpage&gt;我的造物主，为自由祈祷，为自由祈祷。

original_en_text: Late! Late you are! And already a mask. Already a face. It is for those without that I must carve.
original_zh_text: 你迟到了！我迟到了，她戴着面具，我也有脸，我必须为那些没有面具的人做一个雕塑。

original_en_text: Have some small reward for your troubles, Old One. It’s no small thing to deliver that sloshing stuff safe, ‘specially all the way up here.
original_zh_text: 处理冲击敏感物品的安全性并非小事。尤其是在这里。

original_en_text: A fine face, yours. Not of my work. Not of this kingdom’s craft. Not now at least.<page>But the deeper form. Distant relationship. Some form of Pharloom and our old, legged, stewards. <page>Now! To work. To work! The masks are needed.
original_zh_text: 你的脸很漂亮，不是我的作品，也不是王国的艺术，至少目前是这样。&lt;page&gt;从更深层次的意义上说，异地关系就是长腿家庭主妇和我们的老法尔。&lt;page&gt;快点，现在！现在工作！你需要一个口罩。

original_en_text: <hpage>You have the sight, Maker. Tell me what you see in me?<page>Your mask... It reads clear enough, Old One. Watcher, hunter, monarch even, though you may reject that station.<page>A complex visage, perhaps, yet still to my sight it looks unresolved.<hpage>If you see a transitional state, it is one I have accepted. My mask has remained defined through lifetimes uncounted.<page>Aye. Rigid I’m sure, but your kind rarely develop evenly, and the lifetime of bugs are poor measure for one like you.<page>Could be there’s more growth awaiting you yet...
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;我的创造者，我有一个远见。&lt;page&gt;戴着面具，长辈、卫兵、猎人甚至国王都可以拒绝这个地方。&lt;page&gt;这可能是一个艰难的面孔，但在我看来还没有决定。&lt;hpage&gt;当我看到变化，而且是我接受的变化时，面具将在我的余生中保持状态。&lt;page&gt;当然，这很难，但像你这样的人不可能以几乎相同的方式发展，而蠕虫的生活对于像你这样的人来说更糟糕。&lt;page&gt;也许他正在等待成长。

original_en_text: Our world cries its end! But the masks must still be carved.
original_zh_text: 世界结束了！口罩必须摘下。

original_en_text: Enough talk, Old One. Mine is a calling that scant allows rest.<hpage>Very well, Maker. I shall take my leave.
original_zh_text: 我的职业生涯几乎从未中断过。&lt;hpage&gt;太好了，马克，我要走了。

original_en_text: To exist, a face is needed. It is the essential thing.
original_zh_text: 你需要一张脸才能生存，这才是最重要的。

original_en_text: Clever Nuu must know them all!
Wings that beat, legs that crawl...
In waters deep and caverns tall...

original_zh_text: 世界各地的血都在沸腾。

original_en_text: Mark of circle, mark of death...
The road behind us, all dangers passed...
original_zh_text: 路上的一切危险都过去了。

original_en_text: Darn it. Stitch it. Make it whole...
To hide... To nest... To live...
None may die! None may die!
original_zh_text: 没有人会死！“没有人会死！"

original_en_text: Chase the prey fled in fear...

original_zh_text: 我们的快乐！我们的世界！"

original_en_text: For order brought, by claw and blade!
Words that only we may speak...

original_zh_text: 我们烧了它！“我们要烧掉它！“烧死他！
这是一份直到最后的工作。

original_en_text: May Pharloom’s pins gleam bright for all!
original_zh_text: “法勒姆闪耀在你们所有人身上！
我的母亲走了，我的奖励。
权力正在发挥作用。我是沃勒。
平静的呼吸，遥远的电话。

original_en_text: Now none to resist... But us...
What you got there, matey matey?

original_zh_text: 你走错了房间，你的牙齿正在长。

original_en_text: Young must eat, grow or die...
original_zh_text: 孩子们吃饭，长大，然后死去。

original_en_text: Sleep and change, have no fear...
original_zh_text: 去睡觉，穿好衣服，不要害怕。
站起来！我知道他们赢了。

original_en_text: All is mine... for me, for me!

original_zh_text: 我们总是处于领先地位. ...

original_en_text: The holy heights of the Citadel...

original_zh_text: 我希望我的皮肤永远不会破裂。
我非常感谢我的奉献。无限的。
毕竟这一次已经足够了。

original_en_text: <hpage>Bartender, I’ve been tasked to acquire a nectar of significant age. Would you retain any such drink?<page>After the finer stuff, eh? A frightful thing. Word’d long gone silent from over their way.<hpage>I suggest you pass warning to your patrons, bartender. If they’re travelling the bellside paths, best they give that place wide berth.<page>Aye. I’ll let’em know, traveller, though in these cursed times, does any safe path still exist?
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;我的旅程经过沙漠附近的一个村庄，那里挂着古老的纸张。&lt;page&gt;法老的诅咒深深地束缚了他们。一些可怕的事情。消息悄无声息。&lt;hpage&gt;把这个告诉酒保。如果您走在钟楼旁边的街道上，最好远离该地区。&lt;page&gt;是的，我会告诉你的。此时此刻，旅行者有安全的路线吗？

original_en_text: Best be visiting that doctor right quick, miss! She’s up there, at the top of the moors, over toward the bellvein.<page>Her methods might be suspect, but you’re lookin’ sorely in need of service.
original_zh_text: 你应该先去看医生！他站在沙漠高处，寻找他的手表。&lt;page&gt;路上可能会出现问题，但需要大量的维护。

original_en_text: Might have taken me a beat to build the courage, but I can feel it, closer now... the Citadel calling me up.
original_zh_text: 勇气可能是一个沉重的打击，但现在最近的城堡正在召唤我。

original_en_text: <hpage>Here is the Ragpelt, sir. I hope the amount is sufficient for your work.<page>Aye. This should be enough. Once I find a quiet moment, I’ll get straight to building that mighty scarecraw.<page>With a little luck, my roof should be clear of those pests when next you pass by. Thank you kindly, traveller!
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;这是拉格菲尔德！我希望我有足够的钱来工作。&lt;page&gt;如果您默哀一分钟，请立即进行强烈的沉默。&lt;page&gt;如果你幸运的话，下次你经过我的屋顶时，你不会看到任何寄生虫。

original_en_text: If you’re collecting Ragpelt from the crawbugs, those young’ns above here’ll be slim pickings. It’s the mature craws you want, over by the watermound. They’ll drop the stuff a-plenty.<page>Course, you’ll need to do some pointed persuading if you’re planning to separate rag from bug...
original_zh_text: 如果您正在收集蟹壳，上面的身体是另一种选择。这就是您想要的成熟螃蟹。在水山旁边扔一座山。&lt;page&gt;当然，考虑到垃圾和昆虫的区别，需要一定程度的信心。

original_en_text: You’re back, miss! Heard a little commotion below. I trust everything went... erm, smoothly?<hpage><hpage>Sir, your cellar seems to have an ant problem. I assume, in sending me down, it merely slipped your mind to mention?<page>Ah... Oh yes! Well, with your weapon, and talent, and what... I’m sure they didn’t pose a problem? Ahem.<page>And why! I see you’ve collected your prize, so we’ve both come out well from the trade!<page>Enjoy your nectar, miss. No simple pilgrim will ever taste a drop so fine.
original_zh_text: 当你回到家时，你听到骚乱，你认为一切都结束了，不是吗？你同意吗？&lt;hpage&gt;&lt;hpage&gt;你忘记告诉我地下室的蚂蚁问题了吗？&lt;page&gt;是的，正确的。哦，是的！他们使用武器和天赋。真的没有问题吗？咳嗽（咳嗽）&lt;page&gt;为什么？我想我赢了。&lt;page&gt;我希望你喜欢你的饮料。

original_en_text: Ahh. Fair enough, traveller. You’ve clearly got your own tasks to be on with. I’ll manage, no doubt.
original_zh_text: “是的，旅行者，当然是家里的作业。当然，我会处理好的。

original_en_text: As payment goes, I’ve got something I think you’d make good use of. A spare crafting kit.<page>I’d been holding onto it for someone else, but they’ve been gone long enough now, I know they won’t be returning.
original_zh_text: 付款正在进行中，但我认为您可能会从中受益。&lt;page&gt;我已经为其他人预订了座位，但我知道他们不会回来，因为他们不会在这里呆太久。

original_en_text: <hpage>Thank you sir. This is a worthy trade for my work. My tools shall attain an even sharper edge.
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;谢谢，这让我对自己的工作有了很多了解。这个工具很锋利。

original_en_text: My sore shell will cease tormenting me once I reach the Citadel. It’s sung that all ails are healed just as soon as we step beyond the Grand Gate...
original_zh_text: 当我到达城堡时，有人告诉我，如果我走进这扇门，我所有的疾病都会被治愈，但疼痛不再困扰我。

original_en_text: Aye. A fair trade. The aged stuff’s down at the bottom of the cellar.<page>I’ll trust you to collect only the vessel you’re owed. I’d be grabbing it myself, but it’s become a hard climb for my stiffened shell.
original_zh_text: 这是一笔诚实的交易，老人已经倒在地上了。&lt;page&gt;我自己拿了，但因为我的壳太硬了，所以变得更加困难。

original_en_text: S’only those few stronger pilgrims that survive to reach my home now... Pharloom’s curse claims the rest. Poor sods, left to wander.<page>I do sometimes get to wondering... Is it the dregs of their own mind in there keepin’em walking, or something else entirely...?
original_zh_text: 几位强大的朝圣者幸存下来，来到我家。审判的诅咒夺走了其余的人，留下了穷人。&lt;page&gt;这狗屎是让他们走的想法，还是完全不同的东西？

original_en_text: Bellhart, over the moors, a great town I’ve heard it once was, heart of the path’n all, right smack in the middle of these midlands.<page>Now it’s all a’crumble... And that brittle vein of bells is crawling with nasties. Ain’t no place left in Pharloom that can fairly claim to offer safety.
original_zh_text: 听说沙漠中的伯哈特曾经是一座大城市，它的中心就在其中。&lt;page&gt;时钟脆弱的血管，一切都倒塌了，布满了昆虫。法老没有一个地方可以说是安全的。

original_en_text: You visited them pens up above here, miss? Horrid place, once all about growing meat or some such. Meant to keep us moorbugs livin’, and working, its told...<page>That damned place’s long gone to the Haunting. And now the meat’s running feral and free.
original_zh_text: 你看到楼上有关闭吗？我最害怕的是肉。湿地中的动物学会生存和工作。&lt;page&gt;这个地狱已经从它出没的地方消失了，生活自由而野蛮。

original_en_text: Welcome back, traveller. How’d you get along with collecting the Ragpelt from those mangy crawbugs? Their squawking and crooing up there is starting to wear mightily on my patrons!
original_zh_text: 欢迎回来，旅行朋友们!从一只脏螃蟹身上收集鹅卵石是什么意思？他们的尖叫声和叹息声开始对我们的顾客产生强烈的影响!

original_en_text: Hmm, holding on to them, eh? I won’t ask why, but I’d sure appreciate it if you reconsider.
original_zh_text: 我不知道为什么，但我希望你能重新考虑。

original_en_text: Planning to grab that Vintage Nectar? You passed a fair bundle of rosaries for the bottle, so I figured you’ll be eager to see it yours.<page>The old stuff’s down there, at the bottom of the cellar. I’ll keep the trap open for you, just be swift.
original_zh_text: 你想喝这个蜂蜜吗？我穿着罗莎莉山（Rosalie Hill）的衣服，我想看看这瓶酒是否好，所以我打算买一瓶。&lt;page&gt;我的祖父在地下室。我们打开陷阱立即离开。“

original_en_text: Harh! Well met, traveller. Lookin’ for a drink, or a rest, or both?<hpage>Fair greetings, good bug. The warmth of your hearth is welcome upon these wet plains.<page>Aye. It’s a damp climb through these parts. Used to be just pilgrims trekkin’ my way, but odd times these are, and you ain’t even the strangest shell wandering about.<page>A rowdy old warrior stopped through not long back, caused quite a scene, and now a young lass’s taken up lodging in my top room.<page>The lass mentioned she’s on the lookout for sharp types like yourself. Maybe pay her a visit, if you haven’t already?
original_zh_text: 哦!哦!早上好，旅行者，喝一杯，喝一杯，或者两者兼而有之。&lt;hpage&gt;你是一只好昆虫。壁炉的温暖在这片潮湿的平原上很受欢迎。&lt;page&gt;在这个地区，攀登过程很滑。我曾经是路上的朝圣者，但奇怪的是，现在它不再是最奇怪的贝壳了。&lt;page&gt;不久前，一位吵闹的退伍军人停下来闹事，现在一个小女孩睡在我楼上的房间里。&lt;page&gt;她说她一直在寻找像她这样敏感的人。如果我还没有读过，我可以读吗？

original_en_text: Excellent, excellent! Let’s give those mangy craws the fright of their lives! Hah!<page>All I need is some Ragpelt from the crawbugs themselves. Hunt ‘em down, collect their pelts, and bring me back a heap of the stuff. I’ll do the rest!
original_zh_text: 干得好！干得好！干得好！干得好！干得好！干得好！“给一个恶性肿瘤的人一个可怕的生活！“哦，哦。&lt;page&gt;我需要我的龙虾，我会找到它，收集它的皮，带一个袋子，说，“我会做剩下的！"”"

original_en_text: The sooner you’ve collected that Ragpelt, the better. I can’t have those pests killing more potential guests.<page>Business is slow enough already, and clearing corpses ain’t no fun at all.
original_zh_text: 垃圾收集得越快越好。这些寄生虫不会杀死潜在的宿主，但也不会杀死它们。&lt;page&gt;现在太晚了，摆脱你的身体并不有趣。

original_en_text: Wantin’ for a drink, traveller? Might soon be the end for all’o us, so no need to go easy on the nectar.
original_zh_text: 朋友，你想喝点什么吗？我们不需要在蜂蜜中休息太多，因为我们的末日可能很快就会到来。

original_en_text: <hpage>Barkeep, I have seen your request on the bell town’s wishwall. What assistance are you seeking?<page>Ah! Perfect! You’re the able sort that’ll make short work of the task.<page>The problem is those blasted craws atop here. My roof is fast becoming their cosy nest! Now they’ve grown so bold they’re starting to attack pilgrims as they pass.<hpage>Would you simply have me slay them? Your sturdy shell seems more than up to that task.<page>If only it were so simple. Kill the ones above and more just keep coming. It’s the warmth of this home you see. Draws ‘em right in.<page>I’m looking for a long-term solution. A scarecraw! I’ll build the biggest there’s ever been, so fearsome it’ll keep those craws away for good!<page>All I need is some Ragpelt from the crawbugs themselves. Hunt ‘em down, collect their pelts, and bring me back a heap of the stuff. I’ll do the rest!
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;调酒师，我在贝尔镇的欲望墙上看到了一些订购的东西。您需要什么样的帮助？&lt;page&gt;是的，正确的。哦，是的！理想！你是那种工作速度快的人。&lt;page&gt;问题是我们有一只螃蟹。我的屋顶将成为你的避难所。他们变得勇敢起来，开始袭击路过的朝圣者。&lt;hpage&gt;你会允许我杀了你吗？它坚固的外壳似乎工作得很好。&lt;page&gt;我希望事情就这么简单。如果你杀了不止一个，你就会得到更多。看看房子有多热！你有直接的吸引力。&lt;page&gt;我们正在寻找长期解决方案。我知道我已经尽力了，太可怕了，你可以永远远离螃蟹了！&lt;page&gt;我需要我的龙虾，我会找到它，收集它的皮，带一个袋子，说，“我会做剩下的！"”"

original_en_text: Spear-phial containing Plasmium.<br><br>Injecting the liquid allows one to gain health beyond their natural limits.
original_zh_text: 塑料瓶;塑料瓶;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;注射剂可以带来超越自然的健康。

original_en_text: Brace of surgical pins from the Whiteward. Used to forcefully insert Silk deep inside a bug’s shell. <br><br>Increases the speed of binding.
original_zh_text: 使用白色持针器，将丝绸深深插入昆虫壳中。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;更快的连接速度。

original_en_text: Transform Tools while resting at a bench.
original_zh_text: 当仪器放在桌子上时，请更换它。

original_en_text: Hooked tool for the forceful retrieval of loot from bugs and husks.<br><br>Harpoon into foes to steal rosaries and shell shards, while causing additional damage.
original_zh_text: 它用于从昆虫及其壳中强行提取食物。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;科佩尔可以刺伤敌人、引爆玫瑰或碎片，造成额外伤害。

original_en_text: Vicious bracelet worn by those who believe they have not been duly punished.<br><br>Increases damage taken, but also increases damage dealt by the needle.
original_zh_text: 那些相信自己不会受到惩罚的人将被邪恶所掩盖。"&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;这不仅会增加伤害，还会增加针头造成的伤害。

original_en_text: Stalk prey and attack with lethal strikes.
original_zh_text: 寻找食物并发动致命袭击。

original_en_text: Equip Tools while resting at a bench.
original_zh_text: 当你坐在长凳上时，准备好你的工具。

original_en_text: Flexible belt of serrated metal teeth, able to affixed to the hem of a cloak.<br><br>Flaring the cloak will spin the blades, damaging surrounding enemies.
original_zh_text: 在夹克的末端，有一个由牙齿制成的灵活的腰带。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;当你打开外套时，你可以旋转你的刀刃并对附近的敌人造成伤害。

original_en_text: Short pins designed to be scattered along the ground.<br><br>The sharp points will pierce any enemy who steps upon them.
original_zh_text: 短针旨在在地面上移动。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;锋利的矛头会刺穿踩在上面的敌人。

original_en_text: Twin theatrical tools of a vainglorious bug.<br><br>When binding, emits a searing blast that damages surrounding enemies.
original_zh_text: 虚荣是邪恶的双重戏剧性工具。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;攻击对周围敌人造成火力伤害。

original_en_text: Stalk prey and attack with lethal strikes. Build focus with successive strikes.
Spiral weapon fashioned from a hardened conchspire.<br><br>Thrown at an angle, it can ricochet and catch prey off guard.
original_zh_text: 螺丝枪由炮弹的硬端制成。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;当他扔进特定的角落时，他就会跳起来抓住尚未准备好的猎物。

original_en_text: Playthings carved from magnetic material.<br><br>Used in simple games and believed to bring luck to the bearer.
original_zh_text: 玩具是由磁性材料制成的。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;在一个简单的游戏中，人们相信它可以给它的主人带来好运。

original_en_text: Weighted pin and haft, formed to pierce tough shells.
original_zh_text: 用沉重的针和袖子撕下坚硬的外壳。

original_en_text: Light throwing tool, designed for rapid attacks.
original_zh_text: 专为高速攻击而设计的轻型发射器。

original_en_text: Empty spear-phial for injecting Plasmium.<br><br>Acquire more Plasmium to restore the tool.
original_zh_text: 使用半空的小瓶注射血浆。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;将更多血浆带到恢复工具中。

original_en_text: Quick access container formed from an old shell.<br><br>Increases the quantity of crafted tools.
original_zh_text: 用旧贝壳制成的快速进出容器。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;增加复杂工具的数量。

original_en_text: Equip additional Tools, independent of one’s Crest.
original_zh_text: 作为额外的工具，佳士得是一个独立的人。
磁性胸罩（推荐磁性胸罩）

original_en_text: Trap-setting tool of the Weavers. Lays a Silk rune that ignites when foes come into contact.<br><br>Uses shell canisters and the wielder’s own Silk.
original_zh_text: 它包括一个丝绸王冠，当敌人被触摸时，它会激活。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;要使用盒子，您需要使用主人的水槽和丝绸。

original_en_text: Amulet of protection formed from Mossberries.<br><br>As the bearer takes damage, the amulet weeps a green elixir that will form into Silk.
original_zh_text: 泡沫制成的防护服。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;当主人受伤时，护身符从绿色药剂中掉落并变成丝绸。

original_en_text: Invigorating beverage prepared by the Flea Caravan.<br><br>Temporarily increases the speed of movement and attacks.
original_zh_text: 冰镇饮料需要一车跳蚤。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;暂时提高移动和攻击速度。

original_en_text: Lethal trap formed of tightly bound blades.<br><br>Once placed, the trap will pierce enemies that come into contact.
original_zh_text: 由紧密相连的树叶组成的死亡陷阱。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;一旦你设置了陷阱，触摸它的敌人就会注意到它。
一个细胞中有三个细胞。

original_en_text: Cut swiftly and nimbly with short, precise strikes.
original_zh_text: 切割速度快灵活，切割时间短准确。

original_en_text: Repurposed mechanism from the base of a rosary stringing machine.<br><br>Rosaries must be inserted to reload the cannon.
original_zh_text: 它可以在默认计算器中使用。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;您必须输入您的帐户才能重新启动。

original_en_text: Ancient weapon of the Weavers, repaired and modified by Twelfth Architect.<br><br>Uses shell canisters and the wielder’s own Silk to fire.
original_zh_text: 第十二代建筑师修复和翻新的旧机关枪。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;这张照片是和封面以及主人的丝绸盒子一起拍的。

original_en_text: Whip the needle in sweeping swings. Leech the life of foes through twisted roots.
Hardened throwing weapon of the warrior Shakra.<br><br>Blunt force weapon that rebounds between enemies and hard surfaces.
original_zh_text: 战士撒迦利亚的武器&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;一种在敌人和固体表面之间跳跃的小型设备。

original_en_text: Tear foes with savage slashes. Bind to enter a wild fury and steal life from prey.
original_zh_text: 他们以疯狂的愤怒和生命为食，用野蛮的刀刺伤敌人。

original_en_text: Reflective stone with mnemonic properties.<br><br>When taking damage, a memory of the bearer is formed of crystal. The memory will shatter into sharp spines if an enemy comes into contact.
original_zh_text: 它是具有记忆功能的反光石。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;当它被损坏时，它的主人的记忆会形成水晶，当它接触到敌人时，它会被尖锐刺穿。

original_en_text: Holy stone inscribed with a prayer for rosaries.<br><br>Any loose beads will be pulled toward the wearer.
original_zh_text: 石头上刻着几颗珍珠&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;清除传送带上的所有污垢。

original_en_text: Sophisticated Weaver device. Resonates with music played to amplify and enhance a performance.<br><br>Expands and strengthens the effects of the Needolin.
original_zh_text: 复杂的纺织设备与播放的音乐产生共鸣，放大和改善性能。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;扩大和提高Nedrin的效果。

original_en_text: Fabric pouch filled with volatile material.<br><br>Explodes on impact with enemies or when ignited by its fuse.
original_zh_text: 很多鸟。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;它可以在与敌人碰撞时爆炸，也可以在导火索的帮助下点燃。

original_en_text: Ornate artefact of the Citadel, able to hold a Bind’s worth of Silk. Used when healing is needed and one’s natural resources run low.<br><br>The Reserve Bind will be restored when resting at a bench.
original_zh_text: 一座豪华城堡的废墟上保存着温德沃斯的丝绸。当需要加工且自然资源稀缺时使用。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;如果失败，储备金将恢复执行权。

original_en_text: Forged iron bell, crafted to ward against the intense heat of the Deep Docks.<br><br>Reduces the damage taken from flame and magma.
original_zh_text: 石膏手表专门设计用于承受深海港口的极端温度。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;减少火灾和熔岩造成的损害。

original_en_text: Rotary tool used for boring into bone and rock.<br><br>Drives the wielder downwards, while spinning the drill with destructive force.
original_zh_text: 用于挖掘骨头或石头的旋转工具&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;它以毁灭性的力量扭转公牛，就像推开地雷一样。

original_en_text: Charged organ from a defeated Voltvyrm.<br><br>Can be coiled around thread, imbuing Silk Skills with electric charge.
original_zh_text: 沃尔特·韦恩的攻击机器&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;可以用丝绸技巧包裹和填充。

original_en_text: Change Crests while resting at a bench.
original_zh_text: 坐在长凳上时更换图标。

original_en_text: Sharpening slate made from cut and polished Flintgem.<br><br>Temporarily super heats the needle’s blade, imbuing each slash with flame and increasing lethality.
original_zh_text: 切割一块凯尔特石头并抛光。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;在每个伤口中插入火焰并暂时加热针头以增加其杀伤力。

original_en_text: Ancient weapon of the Weavers, repaired and modified by Forge Daughter.<br><br>Uses shell canisters and the wielder’s own Silk to fire.
original_zh_text: 枪是用旧瓷砖制成的，由女孩进行了修复。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;这张照片是和封面以及主人的丝绸盒子一起拍的。

original_en_text: Old bug’s skull carved for protection. Shields against critical damage but shatters on impact.<br><br>If shattered, the mask will be repaired while resting at a bench.
original_zh_text: 古代昆虫的头骨是为了保护它们而雕刻的，盾牌可以承受很大的损坏，但即使在撞击后也可能被损坏。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;如果口罩损坏，请在存入银行时修复。

original_en_text: Pouch containing a fast-acting venom drawn from a flower’s heart.<br><br>Applies venom to equipped tools.
original_zh_text: 它含有从花中心提取的速效毒药。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;毒害团队。

original_en_text: Equip Silk Skills while resting at a bench.
original_zh_text: 在长凳上休息，学习丝绸技巧。

original_en_text: Expanding circular blade powered by a cogwork motor.<br><br>Propels forward, slicing through foes.
original_zh_text: 由带齿电机驱动的细长圆形刀片。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;打倒敌人。

original_en_text: Theatrical tool of a vainglorious bug.<br><br>When binding, emits a dazzling flash that damages surrounding enemies.
original_zh_text: 葡萄酒是一个可怕的工具。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;如果被俘虏，它会发出明亮的光芒，并对周围的敌人造成伤害。

original_en_text: Broken iron lantern containing smouldering wispfire.<br><br>Wisps will spawn from the lantern and burn foes, at the cost of Silk.
original_zh_text: 火焰在一盏破碎的灯中燃烧。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;鬼魂把鸡蛋放在灯上，并用丝绸来焚烧敌人。

original_en_text: Symbol worn to identify oneself to fellow thieves.<br><br>Gain extra rosaries from defeated enemies, but lose some rosaries on taking damage.
original_zh_text: 您可以使用标志来识别小偷。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;您将从击败的敌人身上获得额外的时间，但如果您受伤，您将失去时间。

original_en_text: Cannot use items while in a memory.
Taut-drawing mechanism built from reed and bone, intended for mounting on the limb of a bug.<br><br>Doubles the number of tools thrown.
original_zh_text: 牵引机构由棍棒和骨头制成，旨在连接到昆虫的四肢上。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;使用的工具数量增加了一倍。

original_en_text: Winged cogwork companion that will seek nearby foes and attack.
original_zh_text: 机翼上的同志看到了附近的敌人。

original_en_text: Elaborate, etched Weaver spindle, usable only by wielders of Silk.<br><br>Extends the act of binding, but increases its healing effect.
original_zh_text: 利用切丝载体制造编织轴&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;它增强了抑制作用，但增强了治愈作用。

original_en_text: Cast the blade forward and strengthen Silk Skills with powerful runes.
original_zh_text: 挥舞剑，使用强大的符文来提高丝绸的能力。

original_en_text: Fragile band woven of reed and leaf, crafted to repel Muckmaggots.<br><br>If broken, the wreath will be repaired while resting at a bench.
original_zh_text: 树枝和叶子上的脆弱条纹，专门设计用于抵御昆虫。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;如果您的王冠损坏了，您可以坐在长凳上进行修复。

original_en_text: Fabric pouch packed with unstable powder.<br><br>Explodes on impact with enemies or when ignited by its fuse.
original_zh_text: 袋子里有不稳定的灰尘。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;它可以在与敌人碰撞时爆炸，也可以在导火索的帮助下点燃。

original_en_text: Discarded purse of a fallen pilgrim.<br><br>Allows the bearer to retain some rosaries upon defeat.
original_zh_text: 钱包被扔向朝圣者。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;如果你做不到，你可以放弃玫瑰。

original_en_text: Experimental anklets of Weaver make.<br><br>Draws upon the wearer’s own Silk to increase sprinting speed.
original_zh_text: 链条实验&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;我们用丝绸来加速冲刺。

original_en_text: Attack with heavy, arcing slashes and reap additional Silk from enemies.
original_zh_text: 我们用重弓从敌人手中夺取了丝绸。

original_en_text: Holy bell inscribed with a hymn of protection.<br><br>Shields the bearer as they bind their wounds.
original_zh_text: 种子是经过保护雕刻的。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;在伤口愈合期间保护使用者。

original_en_text: Empty flask which once contained an invigorating beverage.<br><br>Acquire more Flea Brew to restore the tool.
original_zh_text: 瓶子里有一杯冰镇葡萄酒。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;添加跳蚤眉毛并恢复工具。

original_en_text: Emblem of the Order of the Pinstress, the old blademasters of Pharloom.<br><br>Reduces charge time of Needle Strike.
original_zh_text: 老农场的叶子，公主勋章的标志。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;缩短装针时间。

original_en_text: Radial sharpbone used by skilled hunters to take down dangerous prey.
original_zh_text: 熟练的猎人使用锋利的放射状骨头来杀死危险的猎物。

original_en_text: Equip Tools in the Crest menu<br>while resting at a bench.
original_zh_text: 使用Crest菜单行工具&lt;br&gt;我坐在长凳上休息。

original_en_text: Arched sharpbone used by hunters to take down flying prey.
original_zh_text: 猎人用来杀死飞行猎物的尖锐拱形骨头。

original_en_text: Reload Tools while resting at a bench.
original_zh_text: 他坐在长凳上，拿起工具。

original_en_text: Intricate tracking device, carved from shell.<br><br>When equipped, the bearer’s location will be marked on their map.
original_zh_text: 盒子里刻着一个精确的跟踪装置。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;设备完成后，航空公司的位置将显示在地图上。

original_en_text: To change Crest, open the Crest screen of the Menu while resting at a bench.
original_zh_text: 要修改脊柱，请从桌面菜单中打开脊柱屏幕。

original_en_text: Artificial spine that clasps tight around the shell.<br><br>Enhances the wearer’s innate flexibility, allowing rapid retreat.
original_zh_text: 这些人造支柱牢固地固定在头盔上。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;它提供了更大的灵活性，并且可以快速关闭任务。

original_en_text: Convertible orbs containing electricity.<br><br>The vessels can be thrown as a bola for an explosive discharge or staked as a spear to release a column of energy.
original_zh_text: 球的交换是电动的。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;该容器可以用作投掷炸弹的炸药或作为释放能量柱的窗口。

original_en_text: Silk-storing tool of the Citadel, fashioned after an artefact of the Weavers.<br><br>Allows the storing of additional Silk beyond one’s natural abilities.
original_zh_text: 城堡的丝绸仓库是根据纺织工人的技能设计的。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;它可以储存超出其自然容量的多余丝绸。

original_en_text: Crude trinket worn by collectors and crafters.<br><br>Allows one to collect more shell shards from defeated creatures.
original_zh_text: 这对于收藏家和编织者来说有点困难。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;您可以从被击败的生物身上收集更多贝壳。

original_en_text: Gilded piton that allows one to hold in place while on a wall.
original_zh_text: 你可以用黄金将石头钉在墙上。

original_en_text: Tool designed to extract and store fluids.<br><br>To pierce its target, the Needle Phial must first be charged to full tension.
original_zh_text: 液体提取和储存工具。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;为了刺穿目标，首先需要对针施加张力。

original_en_text: Icon of the mythical mother flea, passed down from caravans of old. A symbol of protection and kinship.<br><br>Decreases the cost of Silk Skills while health is full.
original_zh_text: 跳蚤母亲的神话形象是从古代大篷车继承而来的。它象征着保护和兴奋。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;完整的健康点降低了丝绸技能的成本。

original_en_text: Gleaming apparatus of Weaver make. Its core emits a faint glow.<br><br>Increases the speed of Silk regeneration.
original_zh_text: 韦弗创造了一种照明设备，其核心发出微弱的光。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;提高丝绸回收率

original_en_text: Powerful amulet of protection formed from many Mossberries.<br><br>As the bearer takes damage, the amulet weeps a green elixir that will form into Silk.
original_zh_text: 一个强大的防守者会使用大量的杏仁浆果来做到这一点。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;当主人受伤时，护身符从绿色药剂中掉落并变成丝绸。

original_en_text: Equip tools for aid in combat or exploration.
original_zh_text: 在战斗和冒险中，为自己配备工具。

original_en_text: Heavy band favoured by those with an unsteady step.<br><br>The wearer will recoil less when striking foes and will not be flung as far when taking damage.
original_zh_text: 重乐队在节拍不稳定的人中很受欢迎。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;当你攻击敌人时，你的反应很小，即使受伤也无法投掷。

original_en_text: Talisman fashioned from the talon of a large predator.<br><br>Increases the range of needle attacks.
original_zh_text: 用巨型掠食者的爪子制成的护身符。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;扩大针的范围。

original_en_text: Shattered flask which once contained an invigorating beverage.<br><br>Acquire more Flea Brew to restore the tool.
original_zh_text: 破瓶子里有水。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;添加跳蚤眉毛并恢复工具。

original_en_text: Ancient weapon of the Weavers, repaired to its original form.<br><br>Uses shell canisters and the wielder’s own Silk to fire.
original_zh_text: 旧武器又恢复了原来的形状。&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;这张照片是和封面以及主人的丝绸盒子一起拍的。

original_en_text: Spin the needle as a screw, shredding foes. Spend Silk to rapidly craft new tools.
original_zh_text: 它们像生命一样旋转，粉碎敌人。Flor Silk正在迅速开发新工具。

original_en_text: Flat, layered weapon, crafted to be thrown in a set.
original_zh_text: 精心设计的多层平板步枪可以组合成一套。

original_en_text: The Citadel is calling us, sister! We stand so close. We need only the blessing of those bells to see the Grand Gate open.<hpage>I will awaken the bells, pilgrim. With luck, you will not be waiting long.
original_zh_text: “姐姐，城堡在召唤你！我们需要仆人的祝福，因为我们离门太近了。&lt;hpage&gt;“亲爱的，我想叫醒钟声。如果您幸运的话，您不必等待太久。

original_en_text: Only the holy bells of the great path shall open the way!<page>We beg you, traveller, see the bells awoken, that we may cross this final threshold.
original_zh_text: 只有神圣的街角才能开辟道路。&lt;page&gt;哦，旅行者，你可能会跨过最后的门槛。"

original_en_text: Ahhh... the gate! The bells have awoken! All along the path. Now we need only music to see them attuned! <hpage>I have recently learnt the art of producing song by strumming Silk, though I confess it is a skill deserving of more practice.<page>Oh! Ohh! Have no doubt, sister! Play sincerely. Any music is sweet enough! Play for us, and surely the bells will resound! Play, and we will sing!
original_zh_text: 是的，正确的。门！钟声响了！“在这个过程中，你可以看到音乐中的和谐！"&lt;hpage&gt;我最近学会了触摸丝绸和作曲，但我认为这需要一些练习。&lt;page&gt;哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！是的，是的，但是音乐太甜了。让我们一起玩，敲钟吧！让我们一起唱歌玩耍吧！

original_en_text: Ahhh... the Grand Gate! The bells have awoken! <page>We beg you, sister. Play or sing, and we shall follow. Call out to the bells of the path and see the gate open!
original_zh_text: 是的，正确的。门！钟声响了！“&lt;page&gt;“姐妹们，拜托，玩吧，喝吧，继续。我按响门铃，看到门开了。

original_en_text: We beg you, sister. Delay no further! Play for us. Call out to the bells of the path and see the Grand Gate open!
original_zh_text: “姐姐，别迟到了。敲门，看看它如何打开。"

original_en_text: The gate... the gate! O, the Grand Gate to the Citadel stands before us!<page>We are so close! O mighty ones beyond the gate, we beg you! Open the way and let we poor, insignificant little pilgrims crawl into the light...<hpage>I see no gatekeepers to heed your plea, pilgrim, though I too seek entry to the Citadel. Have you heard of a means to open this gateway?<page>Ahh... Weapons blunt it not. No holes for keys. ‘Tis the bells, they say! The holy bells upon the path that open the way!
original_zh_text: 门，门，就在我们面前。&lt;page&gt;那东西太近了！开辟光明之路吧，可怜的朝圣者。"&lt;hpage&gt;我也想进入城堡，但没有看到卫兵在召唤朝圣者。&lt;page&gt;是的，正确的。你不必担心枪、钥匙上没有洞、噪音！圣灵的钟声会为你开辟道路，为你开辟道路。

original_en_text: <hpage>I have passed several such bells, pilgrim. I know how to see them woken. Tell me what you know of their locations, and I shall seek those that still remain silent.<page>Sister? This is a mighty service you willingly perform! What a marvellous gift you would grant to your fellows. <page>Eagerly, I shall tell you of the shrines and their locations, as we have heard them spoken...
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;“亲爱的，我经历过其中的一些仆人。我看到你醒了。“我正在寻找安静的人。&lt;page&gt;我姐姐？这是我们作为志愿者可以提供的很好的服务。这是送给您伴侣的一份很棒的礼物！&lt;page&gt;正如您所听到的，我将详细解释寺庙及其位置。

original_en_text: The gate... the gate! O, the Grand Gate to the Citadel stands before us!<page>We are so close! O mighty ones beyond the gate, we beg you! Open the way and let we poor, insignificant little pilgrims crawl into the light...<hpage>I see no gatekeepers to heed your plea, pilgrim, though I too would benefit from its opening. Have you heard of a means to pass through?<page>Ahh... Weapons blunt it not. No holes for keys. ‘Tis the bells, they say! The holy bells upon the path that open the way!
original_zh_text: 门，门就在我们面前。&lt;page&gt;那东西太近了！开辟光明之路吧，可怜的朝圣者。"&lt;hpage&gt;清教徒，我没有看到警卫会听你的要求，但我会发现你开放的好处。&lt;page&gt;是的，正确的。你不必担心枪、钥匙上没有洞、噪音！“圣灵的仆人正在开路！"

original_en_text: <hpage>On my journey up, I passed many large bells housed in old shrines. Each I have struck awake, yet still this gate stays closed. What other task must be done to see us pass beyond?<page>The bells are rung? Then this sacred threshold may now be crossed, for the final task is simple! Only music, played fair and true. Music shall attune the bells, and see the gate descend.<page>It must be you to lead us, sister! You, who brought this blessing! Play or sing, and we shall follow.
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;当我们到达山上时，寺庙里响起了许多钟声。我醒来，门关上了。我需要解决哪些问题才能克服它们？&lt;page&gt;这是铃声吗？最后的任务如此简单，以至于我们已经超越了这个神圣的门槛！音乐公平诚实，音乐会钟声在门口响起。&lt;page&gt;“姐姐，请带我去吧。希望您能给我们这个祝福！玩、喝、走。

original_en_text: <hpage>Master, I have communed with the shrine above. Your learnings are unique, techniques born of cogwork hearts. Their mastery will require some commitment on my part.<page>Bug-Red, you are the first organic shell to fuse our memories. S-s-s-such behaviour, my line would have believed improbable-impossible. <page>Still, your broad arsenal did suggest strong affinity with the m-m-m-mechanical craft, enough to allow access to our thought-store.<hpage>Yours is an impressive skill, Master. I am grateful for the insight.
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;大师，我接受了上面提到的庇护所。它的教学是独特的，是一种源自认知思维的能力。学习这些技能需要奉献精神。&lt;page&gt;巴格达迪，你是我们记忆中第一个拥有贝壳的人，我们的人民相信这种行为是不可能的。"&lt;page&gt;然而，他们的大量武器表明他们的机制与我们的意识形态武器非常接近。&lt;hpage&gt;教授，您的能力令人印象深刻。

original_en_text: A fine artefact you carry there, Bug-Red. That broken tool, it is Weaver-make? <hpage>I believe so, Master. A relic of their old workshop, lost in fetid caves beyond this Citadel.<hpage>The parts suggest a weapon of thread, one I would attempt to repair myself, had I endless time.<page>An Architect’s work owes much to the art of the f-f-first children. They set expert standard for the tools and talents of Pharloom eternal.<page>If you desire-demand, I can remake the tool, though my own mind-directives may produce u-u-u-nique result.
original_zh_text: 你带来了一艘美丽的飞船，红虫。这是一个用材料制成的坏工具吗？&lt;hpage&gt;它们是他以前实验室的遗物，消失在城堡外洞穴的气味中。&lt;hpage&gt;这些碎片就像一支笔，所以如果我有时间，我会自己修复它。&lt;page&gt;建筑师的许多作品都与幼儿的艺术有关，他们为法勒姆时代幸存下来的工具和人才的专业知识设定了标准。&lt;page&gt;你可以重建工具，但我的心理团队会产生独特的结果。

original_en_text: An intricate implement of Pharloom’s first children. I can restore-repair the w-w-weapon, though it will bear some trace of my identity-idiom.
original_zh_text: 枪可以修理，但它带有身份的痕迹。

original_en_text: Bug-Red. Do you ask-need our service? We shall create, as is our d-d-directive. To serve, for Pharloom eternal.
original_zh_text: 这是一个网络bug服务。一个网络bug服务。你需要它吗？他相信与D-D命令相同的事情：法老的不朽。

original_en_text: Speak now. Thy confession will be heard.

Hrrr. Hrrrrrrr. Them sounds you make. Of holy sort. When me hear such sounds, me remember of home. Me remember of be little.<page>It make it painful hard to work, such remembers. Me must keep working. Please, friend. Do not make them sounds no more.
original_zh_text: 是的，是的。你的声音是神圣的。当我听到它时，我想起了我的家。我记得我年轻的时候。&lt;page&gt;这让我的工作很痛苦。我知道我必须继续做好我的工作。拜托，伙计。请不要惹麻烦。

original_en_text: My s-s-service to you, Bug-Red... As it concludes, I must speak-confess. Long now I have felt my rotors slow their s-s-spin. My limbs lift weak. An ending is felt, coming, sudden-certain...welcome.<hpage>Whatever fading you feel has not shown in your craft, Master. You have provided tools of immaculate make.<hpage>What will follow if you pass? Would another take your place? <page>One cannot. The skill to construct an Architect... That was taken by t-t-time. I am the last-final. The core remains to sustain the song, but no more Architects to tend-toil or build anew. <page>S-s-strange... ‘For Pharloom eternal,’ states the d-d-directive-cage. But how can eternity sustain without an Architect to serve? This seems e-e-error. An end? An error... welcome?
original_zh_text: “我在这里等你，红书。最后，我承认了这一点。有一段时间，我感觉到螺旋桨的旋转速度下降了。我无法举起我的手臂和腿。随着结局的临近，他突然仔细地重新审视起来。&lt;hpage&gt;大师，无论你变得多么苍白，都无法反映你的能力。&lt;hpage&gt;如果他们这样做了，会发生什么？谁将取代她？&lt;page&gt;心脏仍然保留着歌曲，但不再需要建筑师来维护或修复它。&lt;page&gt;有趣的是，“为了法老的不朽”--量子笼子说道。但“没有建筑师的服务，我们如何生存呢？“你看起来不对劲。文件？这是一个错误。欢迎

original_en_text: Hrr. Hrrrrr. Who is there? Me can not... can not clear see....<hpage>At ease, large one. I am no danger to you.<page>Hrrrrr? Hrrrr! Me see you now! So clean, so lively... Surely you did come from above! Me time has come at last! Me work is done. You come to bring me up! Up, up! Hrrr!<hpage>You mistake me. I am no resident of the Citadel. I am a stranger here, though no foe to you.<page>Hrrr. Hrrrrrrrrr. S-stranger? Me grave mistaken. Forgive me, thems above, for me unworthy hope! Of course, me work is not done! Harder, harder! Me must work harder!
original_zh_text: 是的，对吧？他是谁？我的意思是，先生。我看不到他。&lt;hpage&gt;“别担心，我不会有危险。&lt;page&gt;这是什么？你在干什么？哦！哦！我刚刚看到这个！它是如此干净和活跃，以至于你必须站起来说：“我们的时代终于到来了！”“我的工作结束了，你来这里是为了帮助我成长。醒醒！醒醒！哦，哦！&lt;hpage&gt;我误解了。不是城堡里的人。我不是你的敌人，但我是一个陌生人。&lt;page&gt;对不起，但我希望我没有帮助你。当然，我的工作还没有结束！走吧，走吧！我们需要更多工作！

original_en_text: Bug-Red. Do you ask-need our services, even n-now? Our duty is l-l-long, but we shall create for you, if you require it...
original_zh_text: 这是一个网络bug服务。这是一个Web服务错误。你现在需要吗？我们的任务很长，但我们会根据需要创建它。

original_en_text: If Bug-Red could prove their aptitude with our implements, and others like, I would offer my key, to grant access to the chapel-store above.
original_zh_text: 如果巴格·克拉苏可以使用我们和其他工具来练习他的技能，我会把钥匙给他，让他进入上面的教堂商店。

original_en_text: <hpage>Master, I seek a melody held by your line, one part of a sequence and key to ascending above the Citadel. Can you teach it to me?<page>Our melody? I r-r-recall! Yes! There was melody, once, but its sound... that I possess no longer...<page>T-t-t-too long I have worked. From my mind-vault, the imprint has f-f-faded. With many things it is like this... remembrance, dimmed...<page>But you m-m-may hear it, still. At the height of our core, there is means-s-s-system, near complete... Constructs old-built to sound our song. They need only be set to functional form.
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;大师，我正在寻找您的台词所传达的旋律。这是序列的一部分，也是攀登城堡的关键。&lt;page&gt;旋律在哪里？请记住我！哦，是的！哦，是的！只有一个旋律，但只有一个声音。我没有更多了。&lt;page&gt;这是一个很长的时期。在我的内心深处，这个符号已经消失了，还有很多东西作为回忆。&lt;page&gt;但是，在我们的核心之上，我们可以感觉到一个几乎完整的媒体系统。我们盖了一栋老房子，唱歌。您只需要将其安装到功能上即可。

original_en_text: Are you still to c-c-climb our grand core, Bug-Red? Within you may marvel at the work of Architects, my own, and all those passed b-b-before.<hpage>My path takes me in many directions, Master, but in due course, I will ascend the core and claim the melody atop it.
original_zh_text: 巴格达迪，你还能爬到核心吗？在里面，您可以欣赏建筑师、我的建筑师以及所有生活在过去的建筑师的作品。&lt;hpage&gt;大师，我的旅程带我走向了很多方向，但在合适的时候，我会到达内心，将旋律带入内心。

original_en_text: <hpage>May I ask what you know of the Citadel above you, sir? You go to much effort to reach it.<page>Hrrrrrrrr! The Citadel! Most miracle of a place, bright and holy! Fresh water for all, much as can drink! Air so clean, can see the great rooves above! <page>When me thinks of Citadel above, me works hardest of all! Hrrrrrrrrr!
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;你知道性有多重要吗？他付出了巨大的努力来实现这一目标。&lt;page&gt;哈！城堡！“最神圣的地方，就是最明亮、最神圣的地方！尝试喝冷水。天气很冷，可以看到屋顶。&lt;page&gt;当你从上面看到城堡时，你正在努力工作！哦，是的！哦，是的！

original_en_text: You have confessed a sin most grave and must by works cleanse yourself.<page>Return to your task and work off-cycle, neither eating nor supping until new-cycle begins.<page>By the grace of Pharloom eternal, may you never tire. Toil, and be forgiven.
original_zh_text: 我们必须承认我们最严重的罪，并用我们的行动净化自己。&lt;page&gt;不要回到非周期性任务或活动中，在新的周期开始之前不要进食或进食。&lt;page&gt;让我们感谢上帝永恒的仁慈，我们将永不厌倦。

original_en_text: Hrr. Hrrrrr! Good, me friend, good! When us works together, is more holy! Is more work done!<page>Together, lets us work raw hard ‘til thems above see how worthy us is!
original_zh_text: 哦，哦，哦！当我们一起工作时，我们会变得更加神圣。&lt;page&gt;我们将继续共同努力，直到最高层的人们理解我们的价值观！

original_en_text: <page>What’s this, Bug-Red? Even down here, I d-d-did detect its working... Have you climbed our c-c-core, and woken the voices of my l-l-line?<hpage>I have maker. Clearly it was a climb never intended for regular bugs, and fair fortune that the skills gifted within your lands allowed my ascent.<hpage>The melody, and the voices... both are fine things heard and witnessed. Even in this fading moment, their artistry shines through.<page>Impressive-industrious... eternal... You have seen a glimpse, Bug-Red, of us-s-s, how once we were. The minds of Architects inspired. What majesty we did create...
original_zh_text: &lt;page&gt;什么是红色字母？您是否进入了我们的C-C核心并唤醒了我在L-L线上的声音？&lt;hpage&gt;幸运的是，他特殊的地形技能让他能够攀爬。&lt;hpage&gt;旋律，声音。两个看起来都很漂亮。即使在这一刻，他的艺术仍然闪耀。&lt;page&gt;您已经见过我们的红色昆虫，它们是构建我们伟大创作的灵感。

original_en_text: <hpage>Master, you seem the lone maker left in this ruined Citadel. Are you my enemy? The other constructs of this place did object aggressively to my presence. <page>Bug-Red? I am a m-m-maker. Yes. Enemy. No. I am an Architect. Only an Architect. To build-automate, it is our nature-directive-c-c-c-cage.<page>Why are you here, Bug-Red? The time is late. Do you seek-need service of an Architect? You are weave-type, yes, a first child. Rare-e-e-extinct? Or not it does so seem.<hpage>You see it true, Master. I bear the lineage of Weaver, along with other strands, equally strange.<page>Then on your r-r-request, Bug-Red, as directive demands, for Pharloom’s first children, a-a-a-and our kingdom-eternal, I shall c-c-craft.
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;主啊，我相信您是这座废弃城堡的唯一创造者。所有的建筑都强烈反对我的存在。&lt;page&gt;红色盘子？我是一名建筑师，一名建筑师，在自动化中，这是一个自然的序列- c-c - c。&lt;page&gt;你在这里做什么？现在向红建筑师小姐寻求帮助还为时已晚吗？你是一个穿衬衫的男孩，是的，第一个孩子，罕见且灭绝，或者看起来。&lt;hpage&gt;“主啊，看看这个。我身上有女人的血，还有其他的血，还有奇怪的东西。"&lt;page&gt;因此，根据你的要求，瑞德，根据你的指示，我将让C-C - C成为我们永恒巴拿马王国的长子。

original_en_text: <hpage>Master, you seem the lone maker left in this Citadel. Are you my enemy? The other constructs of this place object aggressively to my presence. <page>Bug-Red? I am a m-m-maker. Yes. Enemy. No. I am an Architect. Only an Architect. To build-automate is not choice. It is our nature-directive-c-c-c-cage. <page>You are weave-type, yes, a first child. Rare-e-e-extinct? Or not it does so seem.<hpage>You see it true, Master. I bear the lineage of Weavers, along with other strands, equally strange.<page>Then on your r-r-request, Bug-Red, as directive demands, for Pharloom’s first children, a-a-a-and our kingdom-eternal, I shall serve. I shall c-c-craft.
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;“博士，我相信我是这座城堡的唯一创造者。“其他建筑强烈反对我的存在。"&lt;page&gt;红色盘子？我是一名建筑师，我是一名建筑师，自动化不是一种选择。&lt;page&gt;你是一个穿衬衫的男孩，是的，第一个孩子，罕见且灭绝，或者看起来。&lt;hpage&gt;“大师，你看看这个。我的体内有女人的血液和其他奇怪的东西。"&lt;page&gt;所以，巴格达，应您的请求，我将为法老的长子，我们永恒的王国服务。“C-C - C-C - C-C你不能，C-C。

original_en_text: Hrrrrrrr. The harder me work, the sooner it come. Thems above, them watch us, always. Work hard, work hard, and us will go up. Hrrrr.<hpage>Sir, I fear you are long forgotten by your masters. Should you not rest? The burden this toil is placing on your shell is plain to see.<page>Hrrrrr? Hrrrrrr. You speaks strange. Me can not rest. Us works, and Citadel breathes, and thems above do sing, and all is right.<page>And when us works enough, thems see it... Hrrr... thems see it, and us gets us holy reward...
original_zh_text: 你工作越努力，工作越快，你就会越早到达。他们把注意力集中在这个问题上。看，看，站起来。&lt;hpage&gt;忘记你的老师吧，你是白痴吗？外壳的重量显而易见。&lt;page&gt;这是什么？你在干什么？我们正在工作，城堡在呼吸，楼上的主题真的在唱歌，一切都很好。&lt;page&gt;如果你足够努力，你就会看到它。当你看到它时，你就会得到上帝的奖励。

original_en_text: Tools of my craft. They could be used to improve your own. Make harder, sharper.
original_zh_text: 我有我的艺术工具。您可以用它来改善您的个人生活。它让我变得更强大，更强大。

original_en_text: A flexible shell-prosthetic. It would enhance a weave-type’s flexibility, allowing evasive options.
original_zh_text: 灵活的人造身体增加了织物类型的灵活性，并允许可避免的选择。

original_en_text: You... ... sin... ... cleanse....<page>Return... ... work... ... begins....<page>... Pharloom... ... never... ... forgiven.
original_zh_text: 你是谁？你是谁？不，E。是的是的&lt;page&gt;我回来了... ...你知道我在工作。你知道我在工作。他开始了。&lt;page&gt;...法老从来没有. ...请原谅我

original_en_text: You have affinity for such radial blades? I can b-b-build upon the idea-knowledge. Make them retract. Make them force-store.
original_zh_text: 您对放射性感兴趣吗？根据我对这个想法的理解，请把这个还给我。把它们存入强制存款。

original_en_text: Acquire {0} more tools to prove aptitude.
original_zh_text: 购买该产品。{0}这是一个展示能力的工具。

original_en_text: Hrrrrrr. Me can not say much more, friend. Thems is watching. Us must keep working.
original_zh_text: 先生们先生们，我不能再说了，我们正在被监视，我们必须继续工作。

original_en_text: A locked gate bearing the symbol of an Architect.
Raw materials, for creation. Carry them with you always, that y-y-you may be prepared.
original_zh_text: 创意原材料-我们始终随身携带以备不时之需。

original_en_text: Acquire 1 more tool to prove aptitude.
original_zh_text: 购买其他工具来展示您的技能。

original_en_text: Those pieces of a h-h-heart-core you carry upon you, how did you acquire-recover an artefact so rare?<hpage>They were scattered about the Citadel, each seemingly laid with purpose. Someone wished the thing dismantled, but showed respect enough to see it stored safe.<page>That heart is an inspired form, conceived by the first of my line for a knight of cog and blade.<page>In it, I see my predecessor’s talent, immense, now lost-forgotten. I could never create-copy a work s-s-so fine.<hpage>And the knight that once bore the heart? Tell me of them.<page>A gleaming order, cogwork sentinels, so impressive-majestic in function they were charged-b-b-bound to the highest holy duty.<page>Long before the c-c-creation of the core, the sentinels ventured, even beyond these walls, to see all bugs brought-forced safe to serve the Citadel.<page>If the h-h-h-heart were restored within the sentinel’s shell, would it give thanks for the awakening? Or would it grieve those lands now l-l-lost?<hpage>In time, maker, I may find out...
original_zh_text: 如何回收您拥有的核废料？&lt;hpage&gt;他们散布在城堡周围，每个人都在撒谎。有人想要它，但表现出足够的尊重以保证它的安全。&lt;page&gt;“Heart”是Gear and Blade Knight最初想法的灵感来源。&lt;page&gt;在那里，我看到了我伟大的前任被遗忘的才华。&lt;hpage&gt;“照顾你的人告诉我的。&lt;page&gt;智者骑士是狗牙齿的守护者，履行着非常令人印象深刻和宝贵的职能，并被赋予了最高的神圣职责。&lt;page&gt;早在中心建成之前，警卫就面临着危险，即使是穿透这些墙壁的昆虫也必须为城堡的安全而工作。&lt;page&gt;当你的心回到保护壳中时，你是否因为它被唤醒而感激？这是否意味着地球消失了？&lt;hpage&gt;最终，我们会发现我们的创造者。

original_en_text: This band of metal teeth, sharp and light-fine. It could be woven within your red outer layer? A hidden weapon.
original_zh_text: 你的金属手镯又锋利又轻。你能看到红色吗？影子之影。

original_en_text: <page=S>You seem displeased, Old One. We only did as you asked, yes? The snare is sprung, the creature consumed.<hpage>You bound it to that void!<page=S>Don’t play daft. You should well know our family’s fixations. Surely you had a hunch?<page=B>How else could we hope to trap one of your pale kin? Or see her consumed with such insatiable efficiency?<hpage>Then you have miscalculated, gravely. The white knight, she fell with the mother...<page=M>Oh ho... The quakes, yes? We have felt their force, even here. So the mother resists the dark... to save the child?<hpage>That is my guess. I must descend to the void below, and see clear that truth for myself.<page=M>Ohhhh. How… unfortunate. All of Pharloom will fall to her flailing.<hpage>So it may, but I will not watch idle while it crumbles.
original_zh_text: &lt;page=S&gt;“这听起来很痛苦，老人，你会照你说的去做。你在干什么？陷阱出来，生物体被吸收。&lt;hpage&gt;把它放在空的地方！&lt;page=S&gt;我们需要更多地了解家庭如何运作。&lt;page=B&gt;我们如何联系祖父母？或者我们会被贪婪的效率所吞噬吗？&lt;hpage&gt;我在计算中犯了一个大错误。白衣骑士和他的母亲一起倒下了。&lt;page=M&gt;那是一场地震，对吧？实际上？因此，母亲们抵制黑暗来拯救她们的孩子。&lt;hpage&gt;这是我的假设：我去天堂并看到真相。&lt;page=M&gt;哦，那是什么？为什么？法老的一切财物都在他手中。&lt;hpage&gt;这可能是真的，但我无法逃避。

original_en_text: This lump here is well heavy, and shiny too, so it’s surely worth somethin’!
original_zh_text: 在这里，这部分是沉重的和明亮的，所以它是值得的！

original_en_text: Desperate times make for desperate customers, heh heh! So let’s get to tradin’, eh?
original_zh_text: 绝望的时刻会产生绝望的顾客。想创业吗？

original_en_text: Again... Huu... Huu. Truly incredible!<page>Was it the course? Did I lose focus? Or are you simply the bug I have waited so long for? Her of such skill that my wish could, at last, be granted?<page>Another reward must be given for your speed, nimble bug. One deserved in full!
original_zh_text: 我回来了打电话，打电话。我简直不敢相信！&lt;page&gt;这是比赛吗？你集中注意力了吗？这就是我们一直在等待的BAP吗？我知道你一定有很大的权力。我的愿望会实现吗？"&lt;page&gt;你必须为速度和敏捷错误提供额外的奖励。

original_en_text: Have you heard, miss grown-up? Beyond the moss, in the crumbled caverns filled with worms, much change is happening, different to the horrid, stretching dark outside.<page>What brings such bright and bold transformation? Is it a beast? Or a bug unseen? How wondrous it would be to discover them, hidden away in some deep corner!<page>You must go searching, miss grown-up! You and that sharp, sharp blade. Think of the strange and succulent shell waiting to be added to your journal?
original_zh_text: 皇上，你听到了吗？在地衣的另一端，在一个充满破坏性和传染性昆虫的洞穴里，许多变化正在发生，不像可怕的黑暗正在蔓延。&lt;page&gt;为什么要做出如此大胆的改变？他是怪物吗？看不见的错误？如果我能把它藏在一个很深的角落里，那该是多么美丽啊！&lt;page&gt;“陛下，您看。你和你的剑。想象一下，一个奇怪的多汁的贝壳等待添加到你的日记中。

original_en_text: Now, isn’t this a wondrous place! Golden bells, for weary shells! Ha ha ha!<hpage>This settlement offers safety now, little pilgrim. Perhaps you should make a home here?<hpage>You’ve done well to make it this far, and the roads ahead will only be more dangerous.<page>Oh, dangerous they surely are! But I will gladly tread any path that holds wonders as magnificent as this, red maiden!
original_zh_text: 这不是一个好地方，不是吗？钟声在疲惫的贝壳上响起。哈！&lt;hpage&gt;这种和解将确保年轻朝圣者的安全。&lt;hpage&gt;现阶段，我们前面的道路只会变得更加危险。&lt;page&gt;这真的很危险！“我可以创造这样的奇迹，里德小姐。

original_en_text: <hpage>You have keen sight for my skill, bug, but my childhood has long since passed. What has happened here? I see signs of battle all around.
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;你知道我能做什么，虫子，但我的童年已经结束了，到处都是挣扎的迹象。

original_en_text: <hpage>The time is close, Shakra. The cost was grave, and the challenge steep, but I have claimed a power that can put end to this disaster. <page>Gendaa... This is good, Hornet Wielding Needle, essential. My own strength has near reached its limit, and the dark husks continue their assault unceasing.<page>Take your final action, and let us all see the end of this.
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;时间已经到来，沙尔克的代价是巨大的，问题是巨大的，但我有能力阻止这场灾难。&lt;page&gt;到目前为止，已经.黄蜂可以保持针的平衡。它的强度已经达到了极限，黑暗的贝壳继续攻击。&lt;page&gt;让我们迈出最后一步，看看这一切会如何结束。

original_en_text: Your achievements in the games are inspiring! In time, I may have to challenge those impressive scores...
original_zh_text: 游戏中的成功令人鼓舞。随着时间的推移，您将不得不面对这个令人印象深刻的结果。
