Long dormant centipede, awoken and enraged by Pharloom’s crumbling collapse.
original_zh_text: 在漫长的睡眠中，穆卡德对法老的陨落感到愤怒。

original_en_text: Erratic, flying pest that nests in rags and curtains.
original_zh_text: 一种不稳定且不稳定的寄生虫，在织物或帐篷中筑巢。

original_en_text: Once a hunter purely for food, now they hunt unthinking and unending.
original_zh_text: 过去，他们狩猎是为了寻找食物，但现在他们不假思索地狩猎。

original_en_text: So light they can rest atop still water’s surface. An elegant bug indeed.
original_zh_text: 这意味着您可以生活在充足的光线和安静的水中，这是一个严重的错误。

original_en_text: Its form is absurd... Surely it should not be able to hold itself in the air? The noxious gases in its stomach must provide its levity.
original_zh_text: 这个形状太荒谬了。它真的在空气中吗？他胃里的有毒气体应该会让他松一口气。

original_en_text: Once roused, the bug will crash its steely shell into walls, floors and foes.
original_zh_text: 当你醒来时，昆虫会压碎墙壁、地板，敌人会挖出钢壳。

original_en_text: Elder crawbug serving in a sacred ceremony.
original_zh_text: 老螃蟹参加神圣的仪式。

original_en_text: Agile bug, and one of few hardy pilgrims to have reached the Citadel.
original_zh_text: 这种狡猾的昆虫也是为数不多的到达城堡的顽强朝圣者之一。

original_en_text: Their use of a pin shows hard training. Their use of Silk, unfurled from a spool held close, shows skill far beyond standard bugs.
original_zh_text: 通过在附近的卷轴上使用丝绸，他们展示了一项远远超出标准蠕虫的技术。

original_en_text: Gilded guardian of the Blasted Steps, bearing a cymbal and mallet.
original_zh_text: 他有一个金卫、一个爆炸梯、一把锤子和一把锤子。

original_en_text: A rare, calmer bug of Bilewater, survives its hazardous surroundings by hiding as a plant.
original_zh_text: 罕见的软胆汁细菌可以在隐藏在植物体内的危险环境中生存。

original_en_text: Bug forged of iron, rotor and cog. The automaton works tirelessly to maintain the Core that houses it.
original_zh_text: 铁、旋转盘和牙齿的损失。机器人一直在不停地工作以维持其核心。

original_en_text: Starved pack bug with an insatiable appetite. Despite their tough hide and pungent meat, roaches breed rapidly so are sometimes farmed for food.
original_zh_text: 饥饿无法满足你的胃口。尽管甲虫的皮肤又硬又辣，但它们繁殖速度很快，有时甚至可以作为食物。

original_en_text: They cling fast to the shells of other bugs, destroying any hope for concentration or comfort.
original_zh_text: 它们攻击其他昆虫的外壳，摧毁了集中注意力和舒适的希望。

original_en_text: Pointed, darting insect that builds a hardy hive from Shellwood’s dried bark.
original_zh_text: 有根的昆虫利用树干的树皮建造坚固的巢穴。

original_en_text: Full-sized mite of the Citadel cloaked in an old curtain.
original_zh_text: 城堡的旧帐篷上布满了真人大小的螨虫。

original_en_text: A snapping surprise on first encounter, though one easily avoided once aware.
original_zh_text: 当你们第一次见面时你会感到惊讶，但一旦你写下来，就很容易避免了。

original_en_text: His tracks and traps... It should have been obvious from the start, this old hunter sought to draw me in. But what reason drove him to test himself so brutally? That answer I suspect I shall never know.
original_zh_text: 从一开始，很明显有一个老猎人试图引诱我，但那是什么？他想做什么却做得这么糟糕？别回答我。

original_en_text: Brutish cook responsible for dicing Muckroach meat into edible portions.
original_zh_text: 野蛮的厨师吃了甲虫的肉。

original_en_text: Flighted automaton, responsible for repairing and extending the Core.
original_zh_text: 任务是修复和扩大飞机的原子核。

original_en_text: Giant roller of the lowlands. Its ridged hide will crush smaller creatures beneath it.
original_zh_text: 宽阔而低矮的肋骨状皮肤碾压了下面的小生物。

original_en_text: Shell of a small bug possessed by Silk dregs. The husk will stretch its Silk to form a crude, crushing wheel.
original_zh_text: 小昆虫的身体用一块丝绸固定在身体上，然后丝绸膨胀形成一个破碎的轮子。

original_en_text: Rag-winged adult crawbug bearing a scavenged pin.
original_zh_text: 螃蟹有厚厚的翅膀和掠食性的头

original_en_text: I have not yet seen the bell this automaton is designed to ring, nor do I ever wish to hear it. Such a clamour would no doubt be unpleasant to experience.
original_zh_text: 我从未见过这个机器人设计的钟声，也不想听到它。

original_en_text: If allowed the opportunity, these creatures will grow into a form larger and more oppressive.
original_zh_text: 如果有机会，这些生物会进化成更大、更压抑的形式。

original_en_text: He offered fair warning and challenge, a duel in the purest sense. I admire his honour, and his skill.
original_zh_text: 这是一个警告、一个挑战，从技术上讲也是一场战斗。

original_en_text: Insect formed to imitate a branch, born with sharp, retractable horns atop its head.
original_zh_text: 昆虫模仿头上有尖角的树枝。

original_en_text: Small, soft bug that uses the hard skulls of the Marrow for protection and disguise.
original_zh_text: 这种柔软的小昆虫用坚硬的头骨保护它，并将它变成了木乃伊。

original_en_text: When roosting, it would look convincingly plant-like. In flight, its bulbous body quickly ruins the ruse.
original_zh_text: 当你看到它时，它看起来像一棵植物。在他的飞行过程中，他的球体很快摧毁了这项技术。

original_en_text: Cloth-covered crawler with sharpened forelimbs. Lives and breeds in dark places.
original_zh_text: 爬行动物被布覆盖，前腿上有角，在细胞核中生长和繁殖。

original_en_text: The cost of so much grandeur... Did I peer closely enough into the foundations of my own kingdom?
Stout adult crawbug bearing several short pins.
Greed will always see some bugs swell above their kin.
original_zh_text: 贪婪的人总是看到错误蔓延到同事身上。

original_en_text: This graceful ruler once possessed skill to rival my own. At her youthful peak, her voice united all Skarr in her service.
original_zh_text: 这样的领导者能够与我相比，他年轻的声音概括了整个规模。

original_en_text: False fly with a rune etched shell. A tortured mix of soul and void is caged within.
original_zh_text: 一只壳上写着“鲁尼”字母的假苍蝇被困在痛苦和灵魂空虚的笼子里。

original_en_text: Suction creature surviving on the thick slime that coats its caves.
original_zh_text: 你想要追求的人的身体是基于覆盖洞穴的粘液。

original_en_text: Tall roach tender charged to feed Muckroaches on a lean diet of maggot gruel.
original_zh_text: 大型甲虫需要从蠕虫肉中提取红肉。

original_en_text: Tiny, soft creature that armours itself using the hard, hollow growths of Shellwood.
original_zh_text: 柔软的小生物像贝壳一样保护坚硬的植物。

original_en_text: Taken by Pharloom’s Haunting, the bug is now capable of little more than prayer and aggression.
original_zh_text: 在法勒姆的鬼魂中，昆虫只能祈祷和攻击。

original_en_text: Oversized bug, briefly consumed by anger after its long time caged.
original_zh_text: 这只会唱歌的昆虫被关在笼子里很长一段时间，并饱受愤怒之苦。

original_en_text: From the outset, theirs was a hopeless task. Those wild lands could never be replicated within a space so artificial.
original_zh_text: 从一开始，她的使命就绝望了。他不会在人造宇宙中重生。

original_en_text: Wriggling young grub that lives in darkness.
Their procedures with Silk may have prolonged life within the Citadel, but they unknowingly gifted many minds to the monarch.
original_zh_text: 丝绸可能延长了城堡的寿命，但他在不知不觉中向君主传达了许多想法。

original_en_text: Floral foe that reacts instinctively to movement nearby. Spits pellets of crackling pollen that burst on impact.
original_zh_text: 对手会本能地对关闭做出反应，释放花粉球并在撞击时爆炸。

original_en_text: In contests of speed against strength, I have seen the swift more often triumphant, a lesson I have taken to my own heart.
original_zh_text: 对我来说，斯威夫特赢得了更多的速度和力量竞赛，这是一个教训。

original_en_text: Pilgrim endowed with large wings, carrying a brace of iron bells.
original_zh_text: 朝圣者有巨大的翅膀和一个铁钟。

original_en_text: In my youth, I envied all bugs with wings. I even fancied I might grow a pair... I have since learned better. Accept the limitations of one’s body... and augment with tools as needed.
original_zh_text: 当我还是个孩子的时候，我嫉妒虫子。我想成为一对。从那时起，我学到了更好的东西。接受你身体的局限性。如有必要，添加工具。

original_en_text: Devious ambusher that poses as a fossil.
This bug bears a spool of Silk, which they flail to attack. Though somewhat crude, theirs is a technique much reminiscent of Weavers. I wonder who taught them such a use?
original_zh_text: 昆虫抓住一卷丝绸并摇晃它有点复杂，但这项技术似乎就像一幅画。谁可以告诉我如何使用它？

original_en_text: Her presence would once have maintained the wood’s fragile order, allowing the safe passage of bugs across its branches.
original_zh_text: 它们的存在支撑了森林脆弱的秩序，使昆虫能够安全地穿过树枝。

original_en_text: Though generally passive, their sharp masks can cause injury if carelessly blundered into.
original_zh_text: 它通常是被动的，但如果进入锋利的面具，可能会造成伤害。

original_en_text: I like her. For her willingness to teach and her spirit still strong, despite a long age spent solitary... she has my respect.
original_zh_text: 他独居很长一段时间，但他很担心，因为他热爱教学，而且有一颗坚强的心。

original_en_text: They held long at their vigil, far beyond the age of their brethren, yet still when roused they swung their blade with remarkable ease.
original_zh_text: 他们比我哥哥大，但当他们醒来时，他们用手指量了一点。

original_en_text: Long-horned beast of Pharloom’s lowlands. Relies on its horn both to impale and to wrench the ground beneath it, flinging dangerous debris.
original_zh_text: 低地范纳姆的长角：当他发现自己的角时，他在地上挖了一个洞，并投掷了危险的碎片。

original_en_text: Could their actions be called skill? I see only a crude mangling of meat. Yet I wonder, before the Haunting snared their minds was it any different?
original_zh_text: 您认为您的行为是技术性的吗？但他不知道，在幽灵王国之前，一切都变了。

original_en_text: Darting warrior with sharpened forelimbs and heightened senses.
original_zh_text: 弓有锋利的手臂和敏锐的敏感性。

original_en_text: Mighty percussive disciple of the Choir, wielding a mallet and a Silk spool to wrap and enhance their attacks.
original_zh_text: 强大的攻击合唱团的追随者使用锤子和丝绸爬行动物来加强攻击。

original_en_text: Dual princes of old Verdania, beloved by their subjects for their grace and for the ballet of death they delivered upon outsiders.
original_zh_text: 古代维尔达尼亚的父母是王子，他们因文盲和死亡芭蕾而受到臣民的喜爱，但被发现没有名字。

original_en_text: Huge and soft, a fantastic combination ruined by their haunted aggression.
original_zh_text: 一个又大又软又美丽的综合体，但它被鬼魂的侵略毁了。

original_en_text: On uneven terrain their union of flight and range can prove a challenge even for me.
original_zh_text: 在沙漠地形上飞行和自动驾驶仪的结合对我来说也是一个挑战。

original_en_text: They toiled incessantly for the Citadel, their shells bent and greyed, and now the kingdom’s curse means not even death can relieve them.
original_zh_text: 他们为城堡努力工作，城堡的外壳变得弯曲、灰色，王国的诅咒，甚至死亡，都无法释放他们。

original_en_text: Destroying the hives will limit their presence in the wood. Useful to me now, as I pass along the branches. Dangerous in time for the wood’s order. Even a small disruption can tip a fragile balance.
original_zh_text: 蜜蜂的破坏限制了它们在森林中的存在，当我走在树枝上时，我需要它。这是一个危险的时刻，命令树。即使是最小的伤害也会打破脆弱的平衡。

original_en_text: It has no true mind, and yet fights effectively, adjusting its strategy to my movements. Where exactly are its thoughts written?
original_zh_text: 我不确定，但战斗是有效的，所以我会根据我的动作调整策略。

original_en_text: A bug born entirely of thread. Much Silk would have been needed to see her sustained. A fragile form of life, but life nonetheless.
original_zh_text: 它需要大量的丝绸才能移动。它是一种脆弱的生物，但它就是生命。

original_en_text: Individually they offer little challenge, but their numbers are surely vast, and most remain hidden.
original_zh_text: 就我个人而言，他们面临的问题很少，但数量肯定很大，而且大多数仍然是隐藏的。

original_en_text: A lucky bug to be able to grow old. Pharloom’s roads take most much earlier.
original_zh_text: 菲兰的道路上，幸运的蠕虫可以变老并迅速行动。

original_en_text: Huge flighted creature formed from coldshard.
original_zh_text: 会飞的生物，由冷垃圾制成。

original_en_text: She has lived a mere fraction of my lifetime and yet her rings prove a ferocious match. As gifted a warrior as I have ever encountered, and one I am fortunate to call a friend.
original_zh_text: 我只度过了生命中的一小部分，但她的戒指却是完美的。我见过的最有才华的士兵是那些有幸称我为朋友的士兵。

original_en_text: Sheer bulk makes for an effective weapon, but requires much sustenance. This creature would have spent most of its time eating. An acceptable life for some.
original_zh_text: 排水沟清洁是一种有效的武器，但需要大量的支持。动物大多数时候都会吃自己。对于某些人来说，这是一种可以接受的生活。

original_en_text: These ones grow large, yet I have never observed them eating, or sleeping. They seem such simple bugs... but I suspect they are not truly our cousins.
original_zh_text: 他长大了，但我从未见他吃饭或睡觉。

original_en_text: Huge, hardbone bug that lives within and travels through the veins of old bells across Pharloom.
original_zh_text: 一只巨大的实体蠕虫生活在古代秋钟的容器中，穿过秋天。

original_en_text: Winged devout of the Citadel, carrying a brace of gilded bells.
original_zh_text: 他拿着一个金钟自豪地飞过城堡。

original_en_text: This one would make a perfect pet, but for the freezing temperatures it requires for comfort.
original_zh_text: 这将使它成为一种伟大的动物，但它应该舒适地寒冷。

original_en_text: These creatures look to have been bred deliberately in watery pens. If they are food to be, their scent suggests they must taste vile.
original_zh_text: 如果它是未来的食物，那么气味表明它很糟糕。

original_en_text: Their skill once saw them chosen, and I can plainly see why. They would have lived and trained only for this duty.
original_zh_text: 我知道我为什么选择他们的技能。

original_en_text: For this bug to have survived Pharloom’s climb it must have teamed with stouter companions. I cannot imagine it succeeding alone.
original_zh_text: 昆虫必须在爬上农场时生存下来，并且必须与更强大的同伴合作。

original_en_text: Did this one grow large thanks to the Citadel’s excess, or was its formidable size the reason it ever survived to reach this place?
original_zh_text: 城堡的规模随着城堡的数量而增加，还是它的宏伟仍然存在，所以它就来到了这里？

original_en_text: Though surely fierce, the skull it bears looks taken from an even larger beast. If not for the bones as proof, I would scarcely believe bugs could grow to such scale.
original_zh_text: 毫无疑问，这个头骨很凶猛，但它似乎是被更大的动物移走的。如果没有骨骼证据，很难相信这种蠕虫已经达到如此大小。

original_en_text: Two cogwork bugs, and yet the soul seemed singular? A sad, yet masterful imitation of life, imbued inside shells of iron.
original_zh_text: 你有两个齿轮，但你的灵魂似乎是一个。它充满了铁。

original_en_text: Heavy insect that lives near large bodies of water. Its weighty body is best avoided.
original_zh_text: 昆虫生活在大型物体附近。避免重物。

original_en_text: Drifting bug disguised as a flower. Disperses crackling clouds of pollen if threatened.
original_zh_text: 漂浮的昆虫将自己伪装成花朵，并在遇到危险时释放出花粉云。

original_en_text: Dense knot of husks bound tight by void soaked Silk.
original_zh_text: 幸存下来的贝壳结用丝绸紧紧地绑在一起，沉浸在天空中。

original_en_text: A smart hunter learns to wait long in ambush, always ready to strike the first blow.
original_zh_text: 聪明的猎人学会等待很长时间，并随时准备发射第一枪。

original_en_text: Grazing creature with sharp senses that nimbly retreats from danger.
original_zh_text: 迟到的食草动物可以灵活地撤离危险。

original_en_text: Tiny, timid creatures that huddle in flocks and flee at the first hint of danger.
original_zh_text: 遇到危险时，害羞的小动物会聚集起来逃跑。

original_en_text: Lost in the madness of the Haunting, they still commanded the endless excavation of their caves.
original_zh_text: 他们迷失在幽灵般的疯狂中，挖掘无尽的洞穴。

original_en_text: They rarely relax, always alert for potential danger, even deep in their own territory. To defeat them my focus must match their own.
original_zh_text: 他们不会放松并保持警惕，以防可能出现的危险。如果我们想击败他们，我们就必须非常小心。"

original_en_text: Steam shooting automaton, forged to clean the Cogwork Core and keep it free of infestation.
original_zh_text: 蒸汽喷气发动机经过改造，以清洁糖核并保护它们免受入侵。

original_en_text: Sticky young fly, born and grown in service to the Slab.
original_zh_text: 年轻的粘果蝇被用作仓库，因此它们出生和繁殖。

original_en_text: This mindless bug seems to sense only through its tendrils, yet despite that simplicity it still poses a serious threat.
original_zh_text: 尽管它很简单，这种无脑昆虫似乎是一个严重的威胁，但它似乎只是因为它的卷曲胡须而脱颖而出。

original_en_text: Basic bug of Pharloom, laid low upon the ground.
original_zh_text: 落在地上的昆虫生活在地下。

original_en_text: I am fond of simple, effective traps such as this bug’s extendable spikes. An unwary predator would be skewered clean through.
original_zh_text: 我喜欢简单但有效的陷阱，比如这个虚假的扩张点。

original_en_text: Short pilgrim that uses their long horn to launch upon threats.
original_zh_text: 年轻的朝圣者用长号威胁他们。

original_en_text: Thick-set bug consumed by haunted thread. Uses their solid frame to crush others.
original_zh_text: 扬声器电缆消耗厚厚的安装蠕虫。用强大的身体摧毁他人。

original_en_text: Fur covered crawler with a series of sharp spikes along its back.
original_zh_text: 一种毛茸茸的爬行动物，背上有刺。

original_en_text: Burrowing worm that uses its many blunted teeth to dig through even the hardest bone.
original_zh_text: 头蠕虫有许多钝齿，甚至可以刺穿最硬的骨头。

original_en_text: With this one vanquished, I hope to have sped the end for that jail and its distasteful order.
original_zh_text: 我希望这次失败将加速监狱及其可恶秩序的终结。

original_en_text: Gelatinous coral drifter of simple mind and placid demeanour.
original_zh_text: 口香糖珊瑚表达了简单温和的观点。

original_en_text: Totem and god, built and worshipped by the Burning Bugs.
original_zh_text: 它是由图腾、神灵和燃烧的昆虫建造和崇拜的。

original_en_text: Skittish scrambler of the Far Fields. Its antennae resemble stalks of grass to aid in camouflage.
original_zh_text: 远处隐藏着一个缺陷。水分类似于草茎，有助于伪装它。

original_en_text: Infant fly, freshly hatched. At this age the soft, blind fly is little more than a bother.
original_zh_text: 小苍蝇刚刚长大。在这个年纪，柔软而盲目的苍蝇可能会感到无聊。

original_en_text: Tall creature with sharp senses. Defends its herd with powerful legs and a sharp-tipped mask.
original_zh_text: 这是一种非常性感的生物，用强壮的脚和锋利的面具保护奶牛。

original_en_text: Cruel physician of Whiteward, responsible for operations and modifications on the Citadel’s bugs.
original_zh_text: 维特霍尔德是一位残酷的医生，负责操纵和改变蠕虫。

original_en_text: The huge Judge likely stood through countless generations, never defeated, never wavering in their charge.
original_zh_text: 这位伟大的法官可能从未被无数代人打败过。

original_en_text: These bugs look to have spent every waking moment at their work. Grim, endless labour in service of the unseen Citadel above.
original_zh_text: 我将不懈地工作，为上面看不见的岩石服务。

original_en_text: Despite the Haunting of its shell, it has not been overcome with aggression. Its desire to flee remains too strong.
original_zh_text: 尽管它的外壳很漂亮，但它并没有被入侵者征服。

original_en_text: Coral hulk with a dense shell, bred to immense size by the Citadel’s Memorium.
original_zh_text: 被贝壳覆盖的珊瑚碎片爬到城堡纪念碑上的巨大珊瑚上。

original_en_text: Sturdy bug lost to the Haunting. Rolls at threats with no care for its own discomfort.
original_zh_text: 强大的蠕虫被幽灵蠕虫摧毁。不要担心在面临威胁时感到不舒服。

original_en_text: Tiny empty creature, barely a bug. Swallows its prey whole and sucks their nutrients until nothing remains.
original_zh_text: 这是一种小生物--不是昆虫。它们完全吸收食物并吸收营养，直到没有食物剩下。

original_en_text: Quite a beautiful creature. In my own kingdom’s court, it would have been highly favoured as an ornamental pet.
original_zh_text: 它们作为我王国花园中的装饰动物非常受欢迎。

original_en_text: There is surprising strength hidden in their thin, elegant limbs. It would be a pleasure to ride upon it...
original_zh_text: 他拥有修长光滑的手臂和令人难以置信的有力的脚，喜欢骑马。

original_en_text: Whatever admiration I had for its fleecy down is spoilt by its disturbing mask... and its steely spines.
original_zh_text: 他对羽毛的崇拜被他奇怪的面具和钢脊柱摧毁了。

original_en_text: Cymbal bearing worker of the Deep Docks. Pans the hauls of smokerock to find traces of more precious minerals.
original_zh_text: 为了寻找更有价值的矿物的痕迹，一艘标志性的船只在深锚上摇动了一系列岩石。

original_en_text: Sticky mollusc that defends itself by spraying burning fluid from growths on its back.
original_zh_text: 粘稠的软体动物通过冲走背部的热液体来保护自己。

original_en_text: This one is pretty, but not as soft as first it seems. The plant it mimics is flaked and coarse, and the bug’s coat shares similar texture.
original_zh_text: 它很漂亮，但不像一开始看起来那么甜。植物非常厚实，昆虫的外壳也有相似的纹理。

original_en_text: Low level worker lost to Pharloom’s Haunting. Instinct keeps them at their task, though in much simpler fashion than before.
original_zh_text: 本能地，他们比以前更容易完成这项工作。

original_en_text: Something in their assault reminds me of my own skill, though their talents are born purely of instinct. My technique is formed from hard training.
original_zh_text: “他的进攻让我想起了我的技术，但他的天赋纯粹是本能。

original_en_text: Certain tools and skills can pierce its defences. I should adjust my strategy as needed.
original_zh_text: 你可以使用不同的工具和技能来突破防御，而且你的策略必须根据需要进行调整。

original_en_text: Bug charged to catch dregs of Silk that fall from the Citadel. Will attack with its staff if provoked.
original_zh_text: 煽动者的任务是收集从城堡上掉下来的丝绸残骸，并用棍棒攻击它们。

original_en_text: Similar bugs would gnaw away at unguarded food supplies in my homeland. As a child, I would hunt them, eager to make use of myself and test my skills.
original_zh_text: 这些昆虫可以在没有保护的情况下感染我们的食物。当我还是个孩子的时候，我想追逐他们，为自己而活，测试我的能力。

original_en_text: Automaton built in the shape of a scuttling bug. Its back contains retractable pins, intended to cut song cylinders free of any obstruction.
original_zh_text: 该机器人的形状像一只会飞的昆虫，前面有一根延伸的刺，旨在无障碍地切割弯曲的管道。

original_en_text: Uses their steel-bristled pin to scrub the soot from vents and pipes.
original_zh_text: 要清除通风口和管道中的灰尘，请使用钢螺丝。

original_en_text: Huge, yet stealthy Skarr. An expert trapper and master of the undergrowth.
Lashing fragments of pure darkness, shaped into sharpened tentacles.
original_zh_text: 攻击纯粹黑暗的尖锐碎片，形成触手。

original_en_text: Soft bug beneath a huge, horned skull. Charges at intruders to protect its territory and its smaller companions.
original_zh_text: 头骨下方是一种又大又软的昆虫，长着长角。入侵者必须保护他们的领土和他们的小伙伴。

original_en_text: Common winged bug of the lowlands. Generally docile, but will attack if threats come close.
original_zh_text: 昆虫通常生活在低海拔地区。他们通常保持沉默，但在威胁逼近时发动攻击。

original_en_text: Foul creatures birthed into servitude. Their plight elicits no sympathy from me.
original_zh_text: 这个不洁的生物生来就是奴隶，她的处境并没有引起我的同情。

original_en_text: The Haunting has stolen some important part of these bugs, yet still they attempt their former task. Until, that is, they sense my presence...
original_zh_text: Haunted窃取了许多这些错误，但看看之前的挑战，我感觉到了我的存在。

original_en_text: Mutated young worm infected with Plasmium. The new form displays potent regenerative skill.
original_zh_text: 变异幼虫突然感染疟原虫。

original_en_text: Its core is filled with fine mechanisms, but that alone should not produce such a convincing mimic of life. Silk must also be used to animate this artifice, though exactly how I am not sure.
original_zh_text: 它的核心充满了复杂的机制，但这并没有让生命模拟器本身如此有吸引力。我们需要使用丝绸来激活这项技术，但这不是我们使用它的方式。

original_en_text: Its shell gives it the advantage of surprise, but also forces it into a slender, brittle shape that cannot withstand a heavy attack.
original_zh_text: 它的外壳给了它意想不到的好处，但也给了它一种漫长而脆弱的外观，无法承受暴力攻击。

original_en_text: Predatory plant with a powerful jaw shaped to resemble a lily pad.
original_zh_text: 捕食者，下巴硬得像百合花

original_en_text: Airborne pest, less common than its grounded siblings. Attacks with sharp fangs if agitated.
original_zh_text: 空气传播的寄生虫比土壤中的类似寄生虫更常见。当他醒来时，他会用锋利的牙齿攻击。

original_en_text: The souls of so many bugs, obsessed with Silk, consumed by it. Their pain shall forever remain in that pit. Even I do not possess strength enough to cleanse it.
original_zh_text: 许多昆虫的灵魂被丝绸占领和吞噬，它们的痛苦永远留在它们的洞里。

original_en_text: Silk-spun child possessed by the void.
Shell-plated worm found only in the deepest depths. Seems to survive despite consuming no food or liquid.
original_zh_text: 在她身体的最深处发现了一种癌虫，她显然在没有吃食物或液体的情况下幸存下来。

original_en_text: Trap setting bug carrying a pouch of sharpened long-stakes.
original_zh_text: 抓住他的昆虫有一个又长又尖的袋子。

original_en_text: Aged female mite, grown larger and stronger than most of its kin.
original_zh_text: 年长的雌性比其他物种更大、更强壮。

original_en_text: Mass of old masks swollen and animated by writhing void.
original_zh_text: 许多旧口罩是由于裂缝爬行和扩张造成的。

original_en_text: Pernicious looter found all over Pharloom.
Small bug, shackled and cowled for sin committed within the Citadel.
original_zh_text: 巴加因在城堡中犯下的罪行而被戴上手铐并被迫戴上面纱。

original_en_text: Flighty insect that lives beside still waters.
original_zh_text: 生活在平静水域附近的轻型昆虫。

original_en_text: Its form is certainly based on bugs found outside the Citadel. In my own craftwork, I too often look to nature for inspiration.
original_zh_text: 它的形状基于城堡外自然发现的昆虫。在我的艺术中，我经常画自然。

original_en_text: Birth equipped this one well. In its assault it becomes its own projectile.
original_zh_text: 那个人的手臂生来就是他攻击时的投射。

original_en_text: Their heavier bells armour them well against my strikes, but against that oppressive heat... can they help at all?
original_zh_text: 他们沉重的奴隶会保护他们免受我的打击，但他们也会保护他们免受高温和蒸汽的影响。

original_en_text: A rare built bug within these ailing lands. Most pilgrims’ shells seem small by comparison. What nourishment did they discover to grow so large?
original_zh_text: 这是病态土壤中的一种罕见昆虫。与此同时，大多数朝圣者的贝壳看起来很小。重要的营养素有哪些？

original_en_text: With a softer shell than most, they would have relied on their athleticism to survive.
original_zh_text: 由于贝壳比大多数人都软，因此它们只能依靠自己的移动能力生存。

original_en_text: Common crawler that lives beneath sand.
original_zh_text: 生活在海滩上的爬行动物。

original_en_text: Silk and shells corrupted. That void seeks now to claim this land whole. These poor shells are only the beginning.
original_zh_text: 丝绸和贝壳有腐蚀性。现在他们正试图征服这片土地。

original_en_text: Screeching scavenger that roosts high in caverns and preys on passing pilgrims.
original_zh_text: 尖叫的猎人住在洞穴里，利用路过的朝圣者。

original_en_text: Insect formed to imitate a branch, capable of remaining perfectly still for long periods, but unexpectedly swift when roused.
original_zh_text: 模仿树枝的昆虫在很长一段时间内保持完全静止，但它们可能会以惊人的速度醒来。

original_en_text: This larger form carries so much weight it can barely move from its place.
original_zh_text: 这个巨大的形状非常重，几乎不可能将其从形状中删除。

original_en_text: Small construct built by Weavers past, brought to life through Silk runes threaded within.
original_zh_text: 韦弗过去的小结构通过通往内部的丝绸走廊进行了修复。

original_en_text: The less these gruesome bugs breed, the better.
original_zh_text: 这些可怕的昆虫繁殖得越少越好。

original_en_text: Gilded servant of the Whispering Vaults, born to read and recall the near endless scrolls of prayer.
original_zh_text: 房间里的金仆人低声念着无限的祈祷，以阅读和记住。

original_en_text: I cannot decipher its function to the greater Core. Is it built for defence? If so, its passivity seems far from optimal.
original_zh_text: 我们能否破译它对核防御的最大影响？如果是这样，那么这种被动性就是不完美的。

original_en_text: If not for the spikes, I would think it an appealing bug.
original_zh_text: 如果没有手指，我认为这将是一个迷人的错误。

original_en_text: Hovering pest with a hollowed proboscis able to spit gobs of sizzling bile.
original_zh_text: 寄生在空茎上的寄生虫可以吐出胆汁。

original_en_text: This surface dweller is free of Silk. Its nature remains its own. The monarch’s influence must only have stretched below it.
original_zh_text: 这片土地上的居民不是丝绸。你的心就是你的份。国王的影响力较小。

original_en_text: Did they ever truly understand those inscrutable scrolls? Or is it all merely pretence, an endless act to maintain their order’s station within the Citadel?
original_zh_text: 你真的知道这个谜团吗？还是应该以无限的视角来维持城堡的秩序和地位？

original_en_text: Its assault... like a young bug’s toy turned deadly. Could I, in time, fashion a spinning tool to match?
original_zh_text: 这就像一只小昆虫变成了致命的玩具。你能及时制作出旋转乐器吗？

original_en_text: Though grey with age, their frayed form suggested a being strung from Silk, one who welcomed a decisive end in combat over a slow decline.
original_zh_text: 他的外表因年龄而撕裂，是丝绸人面临缓慢下降的战斗的决定性结论。

original_en_text: Infant form of the more formidable Craggler.
original_zh_text: 克鲁格最有权势的儿子。

original_en_text: Either its size has made it fearless or the Haunting has removed its sense of self-preservation.
original_zh_text: 要么你的形状让你害怕，要么你的依恋让你失去自我保护感。

original_en_text: Barely a bug, and possessing only basic thought, yet instinct alone proved enough to turn it deadly.
original_zh_text: 这是一个基本想法，不是错误，但事实证明，本能可能是致命的。

original_en_text: Bursts forth at movement sensed close, and will consume any object or bug careless enough to fall into its maw.
original_zh_text: 当它们听到附近的动静时，它们就会爆炸，不小心吃掉物体或昆虫，最终落入它们的胃里。

original_en_text: Pointed scurrier posing as plant life.
Verminous pest, common throughout the dark corners of Greymoor.
original_zh_text: 寄生虫经常出现在格里莫的黑暗角落。

original_en_text: Its fur is thick and silky. Sadly, lost to its Haunting, I shall never safely be able to touch it.
original_zh_text: 她的皮肤又厚又软。不幸的是，她永远不会安全，因为她不会被触摸。

original_en_text: Her body seemed a Weaver’s, but her mask had been forcibly removed, and her own Silk was bound useless by heavy pins lodged through her spine.
original_zh_text: 她的身体看起来像一个框架，但面具被强行摘下，丝绸被沉重的荆棘绑在一起，插入脊柱。

original_en_text: Fierce and fast, and defending their lands even from birth. These are children to be proud of.
original_zh_text: 他坚强而敏捷，从出生起就保护着他的国家。

original_en_text: Like fabric somehow sprung to life. Its pelt is perfectly matched to the rags it infests.
original_zh_text: 但不知何故，它会复制。皮肤完全适合感染的组织。

original_en_text: Its wings are quite small compared to its bulk. Perhaps it uses the warm air of these fiery lands to help stay airborne. Clever, if so.
original_zh_text: 翅膀相对于其尺寸来说非常小，因此明智的做法是使用来自温暖地球的热空气来容纳空气。

original_en_text: Gold ranked disciple of the Choir and direct servant to the Citadel’s Conductors.
original_zh_text: 当地合唱团的金徒隶属于当地指挥官。

original_en_text: The large bell seems to signify them as once leader of a climbing troupe, though the Haunting has erased that former authority.
original_zh_text: 这些巨大的奴隶似乎表明他们曾经是登山队的领导者，但他们的痴迷已经抹去了他们以前的权威。

original_en_text: Avoiding their ambush is a good test of my senses, and my ability to rapidly retaliate.
original_zh_text: 避免伏击是对我情绪和快速战斗能力的很好考验。

original_en_text: To quell the mother’s rage, and see this kingdom saved, I will claim her back. This one... the dark shall not take.
original_zh_text: 我把母亲还给了我，以缓解我的愤怒并拯救王国。

original_en_text: Cogwork knight of Pharloom, once protector of its pilgrims, and master of the scissor blade.
original_zh_text: 武装秋季骑士是朝圣者和香料商人的守护者。

original_en_text: <page>No. Not their enemy, and their prisoner not through malice. I am Eva, a thing... difficult to describe, a child of Weavers, yet not quite their kin...<hpage>How strange. That description could fit me as well as yourself. <page>Child of Weavers?... And not? I can detect your Weaver strain, yet you are different from them, and from me, a shifting, blended thing? What are you creature?<page>Step closer, lady, that my senses would better understand your nature.
original_zh_text: &lt;page&gt;他的敌人和囚犯都不是韦弗的孩子，但他的父母也不是。&lt;hpage&gt;这真的很奇怪。这个描述非常适合您。&lt;page&gt;INVC纺织产品有很多选择，但是. ...你不像他们，你不像我，你正在进化和混合，你是什么样的生物？&lt;page&gt;你离得越近，你就越了解我的感受。"

original_en_text: Lady, still my senses resound. You seem so far beyond the bounds of a bug.<page>Permit me to gaze again upon your nature, that I may offer clarity.
original_zh_text: 我的情绪总是引起共鸣。看来你已经克服了这个错误。&lt;page&gt;如果你再看看你的本性，我会给你最终的答案。

original_en_text: Lady? So you live, still. This is good... I had felt the conflict commence, pale hearts ablaze, and the sudden well of darkness after.<hpage>I am sorry, Eva. I had hoped to slay the monarch, and was near achieving that goal, but the situation has become... complicated. Now, all of Pharloom threatens to fall.<page>But I can sense it in you, lady. You have not yielded to despair, so some hope must still remain?<hpage>...Slim hope, I suspect. But true, there may yet be a way through this disaster. I shall pursue that goal with whatever strength remains.<page>Then allow me to continue to aid you as I can... Mine might be a small contribution, but I shall provide it eagerly.
original_zh_text: 夫人？所以你还活着，一切都很好，一切都很好，我感到冲突，我苍白的心在燃烧，然后突然间，黑暗的深渊开始了。&lt;hpage&gt;对不起，我想杀死伊芙王，但发生了什么？情况变得越来越复杂，现在整个帕哈姆都面临崩溃的危险。&lt;page&gt;“对不起，小姐，如果你不绝望，你还会有希望吗？”&lt;hpage&gt;...也许我们的希望渺茫，也许我们有办法克服这场灾难，我们将尽一切努力实现这个目标。&lt;page&gt;我们的贡献可能很小，但我们会尽力为您服务。

original_en_text: Incredible... Your nature is so unlike a mortal bug’s. Yours is malleable, transitory. It is a marvelous thing, worth my long life to behold.<page>With what power I possess, I may still be able to aid you further.
original_zh_text: 令人难以置信的... ...它的性质与人类蠕虫的性质有很大不同。你的衣服很小，是塑料的。值得在我的生活中看到它。&lt;page&gt;如果我有力量，我可以帮助你更多。

original_en_text: <hpage>Eva, I am seeking a tool, told to be somewhere in this structure. It is a snare device of Weaver make. Do you know of it?<page>I may, lady. Search over from here, on side where the moss meets the nest. There, my mothers built their tools, all traps and bindings. Small things, but tests for larger forms.<page>I still remember their thoughts as they worked, their desperation, and their hunger. Another hopeless attempt to wrest their freedom. All ended in failure, of course.
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;伊娃，我正在那栋楼里寻找工具。&lt;page&gt;- 看看甲虫和巢穴的交汇处。母亲创造工具、陷阱和限制。这是一个小问题，但正在以更大的方式经历它。&lt;page&gt;我仍然记得他对工作、绝望和饥饿的想法，这是徒劳的试图剥夺他的自由。

original_en_text: Ain’t you come a long way, bellringer! Granting wishes, saving bugs, even rousing my sullen family to act!<page>The snare is set above, our power bound along its thread. To your sight it may seem a crude thing, but there’s fair strength to it... enough to quell a god.<hpage>You and your family have done me well, sir. I shall prove your faith in the meeting ahead.<page>Aye. Bring your best, bellringer. Call forth our great pale god. Cut her weak, then drive the beast down atop the snare.<page>Contact made will stir the snare alight, but only your needle’s song will awaken the spell in full. When that moment arrives, you’ll see it clear.
original_zh_text: 你已经走了很长的路，巴里。唤醒不幸的家人，实现愿望，避免错误，采取行动！&lt;page&gt;这是一个与我们的力量相连的陷阱。他可能看起来不礼貌，但他有相当大的权力。&lt;hpage&gt;你和你的家人对我非常好。&lt;page&gt;“做你最好的角色，贝林格，祈祷伟大的上帝减少你的力量并捕获野兽。&lt;page&gt;陷阱是通过触摸激活的，但只有针头才能完全唤醒咒语。

original_en_text: <page>Lady, please. Permit me to look upon your nature, that I may offer clarity...
original_zh_text: &lt;page&gt;让我们来审视它的本质并澄清它。

original_en_text: Incredible... Your nature is so unlike a mortal bug’s. Yours is malleable, transitory. It is a marvelous thing, worth my long life to behold.<page>If in your travels you are able to further evolve, return to me. With what power I possess, I may be able to aid you further.<hpage>Thank you, Eva. If my nature expands as you say, I shall return.
original_zh_text: 令人难以置信的... ...它的本质与人性完全不同。你的小可塑性是一种令人难以置信的现象，值得在我漫长的一生中留下深刻的印象。&lt;page&gt;如果你能在旅途中取得进展，请回到我身边。&lt;hpage&gt;谢谢伊芙！当我的本性被传播时，正如你所说，我就会回来。

original_en_text: <hpage>I have known your kind before, sir. Yours is a tribe that works and trades in power, and I am about to extinguish its prime source.<hpage>Once this is done, will you truly delight in a land so bereft?<page>Aye, well... My family’s marks are all over that trap. And we’ve spent a hard age avoiding the gaze of our god.<page>If we earned it now, after such open opposition... that’s a bleak conclusion none of us’d care for.<page>Now! My job’s done. S’time your grand business began! We’ll be wishin’ victory to you, bellringer, for all our sakes!
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;你们的部落是一个充满工作和权力谈判的部落，我正在努力消除造成这种情况的原因。&lt;hpage&gt;当这一切结束时，我在失去亲人的地球上真的会幸福吗？"&lt;page&gt;我们的房子关闭了，很难逃脱上帝的眼睛。&lt;page&gt;在全国反对之后，如果我们现在赢了，那将是一个没有人关心的悲伤结局。&lt;page&gt;快点，现在！是时候开始伟大的职业生涯了。让我们大家敲响钟声，祝愿胜利！

original_en_text: <hpage>You see one’s nature, Eva? It is a skill far beyond bugs.<page>One not without cost. My sight perceives a bug only through the imprint upon their soul. <hpage>You speak of their crest? That signifier of a bug’s essence and their invisible yoke born through a lifetime.<page>Crest? Yes, the old Weaver term. A simple word to attempt description of something so profound.<page>But wait. Your own nature... Is it?...<page>Lady, permit me to look deeper still, that I may offer clarity...
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;你见过人性吗？错误是超越错误的能力。&lt;page&gt;我的眼睛只能看到昆虫灵魂的痕迹。&lt;hpage&gt;您在温尼伯吗？它象征着昆虫的本质和无形的生命链。&lt;page&gt;克里斯蒂娜的？在韦弗身上，这是一个可以用一个词概括的古老术语。&lt;page&gt;你正在等待你的本性，真相。&lt;page&gt;它可以提供更深入的理解和更清晰的信息。

original_en_text: Lady, Pharloom’s time grows short. If you are able to further expand your nature, I urge you return to me.<page>Any power I possess, I shall grant it for your aid.<hpage>My thanks, Eva. If my nature expands as you say, I shall return.
original_zh_text: 如果您在法罗群岛的时间很短，如果您可以进一步传播自然，我建议您回到我身边。&lt;page&gt;无论你有什么，我都会用它来帮助你。&lt;hpage&gt;谢谢伊芙！当我的本性被传播时，正如你所说，我就会回来。

original_en_text: Stay back, twisted leech! Even lodged within another’s shell, your ravenous nature shines clear.<page>You shall not defoul this chamber, nor claim my soul. Begone!
original_zh_text: “回来吧，弓坏了。即使在别人的壳里，贪婪的本性也会闪闪发光。&lt;page&gt;我不能夺走你的房间，我不能夺走你的灵魂，快跑！

original_en_text: Lady... Incredible... Your nature is so unlike a mortal bugs. Yours is malleable, transitory. It is a marvelous thing. Worth my long life to behold.<page>Unbound one, though we know each other little, permit me to ask a selfish request.<hpage>Your talent has provided a great benefit, Eva. What is it you desire of me?<page>Only to have my own soul, my own memories, bound within your shell... As you have done with those others throughout these lands.<page>I would not define as a crest within you, but my small strength may still grant a final boon.<hpage>You ask to be subsumed? Know your mind would cease to be, in any independent sense.<page>To be united with one unbound... This is the kind of escape I once prayed for, though the weight of ages had almost made me forget.<page>Lady, would you grant me this request?
original_zh_text: 夫人...令人难以置信的... ...它们的性质与昆虫完全不同。我的小塑料太大了。我感谢我的长寿&lt;page&gt;我们自由的人提出我们不知道的自私要求。&lt;hpage&gt;伊娃的才华给我们带来了巨大的优势。你想让我做什么？&lt;page&gt;我紧紧抓住你的壳，拥有我的灵魂和记忆，就像你在地球上的任何地方一样。&lt;page&gt;虽然我没有将它指定为你灵魂的象征，但我的小小力量仍然可以给你带来最大的祝福。&lt;hpage&gt;你想加入他们吗？你知道，你的思想不再独立存在，你不再在同一个地方。&lt;page&gt;与无残疾人一起工作一直是我祈祷的避难所，但在时间的压力下，我几乎忘记了。&lt;page&gt;您同意此请求吗？" "

original_en_text: Lady, you are a multitude within a single shell. A being truly unbound. To aid your growth has proved a grand task, even for one as limited as me.<page>As my last act, permit me to ask a final, selfish request.<hpage>Your talents have provided great benefit, Eva. What is it you desire of me?<page>Only to have my own soul, my own memories, bound within your shell... As you have done with those others throughout these lands.<page>I would not define as a crest within you, but my small strength may still grant a final boon.<hpage>You ask to be subsumed? Know your mind would cease to be, in any independent sense.<page>I know. And still I seek it, gladly. To be united with one unbound... This is the kind of escape I once prayed for, though the weight of ages had almost made me forget.<page>Dear Lady, would you grant me this request?
original_zh_text: 在一个真正自由的人的壳里，有很多人可以帮助你成长，但对于像我这样的人来说是有限的。&lt;page&gt;总的来说，我希望。&lt;hpage&gt;伊娃，你的天赋给了你很大的优势。&lt;page&gt;我紧紧抓住你的壳，拥有我的灵魂和记忆，就像你在地球上的任何地方一样。&lt;page&gt;虽然我没有将它指定为你灵魂的象征，但我的小小力量仍然可以给你带来最大的祝福。&lt;hpage&gt;你想加入他们吗？要知道你的思想不再独立存在，你不再在同一个地方。&lt;page&gt;随着时间的推移，她的祈祷逃避几乎被遗忘了，但这就是她的祈祷逃避。&lt;page&gt;亲爱的朋友们，您同意这个请求吗？

original_en_text: Who’s there? Has someone come to free me? Or are you here to bring my end? <hpage>I am Hornet, prisoner, only a traveller and not here to slay you.<hpage>What cause sees you caged in these ruins of Weavers past? Were you their enemy?
original_zh_text: 他是谁？谁在帮你？还是你想和我分手"&lt;hpage&gt;我很困惑。我是一名囚犯，只是一名旅行者。"&lt;hpage&gt;是什么让你陷入韦弗废墟？你是我们的敌人吗？

original_en_text: Lady, my senses resound. You have grown further beyond the bounds of a bug.<page>Permit me to gaze again upon your nature, that I may offer clarity.
original_zh_text: 你的成长正朝着错误的方向发展。&lt;page&gt;如果你再看看你的本性，我会给你最终的答案。

original_en_text: <hpage>How did you come to be sealed here, Eva? <page>Lady, you mistake. What seems a cage is as much my shell as the form inside.<page>I was born within this space. To leave would be my death, an uninspired end, though one I’ve sometimes wished would come.<page>I am unique, you see. My mothers shared the curse of their tribe, to conceive a child is a painful, near impossible task. <hpage>I know the curse well, Eva, for I am also its victim, and spawn of one who managed to overcome its limits. <hpage>Are you too an attempt to defy that cruel constraint?<page>A flawed attempt. A life spun from rune and shell, sustained only by its cage. My thoughts may mimic a Weavers, but my senses are my own.<page>Over time, that difference brought only distance between us.
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;你怎么来的伊娃&lt;page&gt;看起来像细胞的东西是我的外壳，我的内部形状。&lt;page&gt;它开始于我的死亡，一个有点令人兴奋的结局，但有时我希望它会来。&lt;page&gt;我很独特，不是吗？你看到这个了吗？母亲发誓怀孕就像部落一样痛苦，几乎不可能。&lt;hpage&gt;因为我也是受害者，是超越我极限的人的后裔。&lt;hpage&gt;他能忍受如此困难的处境吗？&lt;page&gt;生命由符文和贝壳组成，只能保存在我们内心。我的心可以模仿布料，但我的情感就是我。&lt;page&gt;随着时间的推移，这些差异会让我们更加亲密。

original_en_text: By your grace, I am at last broken from my fate.<hpage>Gladly I accept your union, Eva. No longer shall you suffer eternity alone.
original_zh_text: 多亏了你，我终于走上了自己的道路。&lt;hpage&gt;我很高兴嫁给伊娃，我不能永远独自生活。

original_en_text: Come no closer! I sense the forbidden blood coursing through you, that which grows and reshapes the world in its own vulgar image.<page>Whether it was imbibed willingly or not, none shall be allowed into this chamber while so afflicted. Begone!
original_zh_text: 快跑快跑你可以感觉到禁忌的血液在你的身体中流淌，成长为粗俗的形象，重建世界。&lt;page&gt;在这个痛苦的时刻，无论是否愿意，任何人都不能进入这个房间。

original_en_text: Lady, if in your travels you are able to further expand your nature, return to me. With what power I possess, I may be able to aid you further.<hpage>If my nature expands as you say, Eva, I shall return.
original_zh_text: 女人，如果你能在旅途中扩展你的本性，就来找我吧，我可以用我的力量来更多地帮助你。&lt;hpage&gt;伊芙，当我的本性扩展时，正如你所说，我就会回来。

original_en_text: Lady, would you think again upon my last request? To be bound amidst your shimmering soul?<page>I understand it is a selfish thing to ask, and I will hold no ill will if you reject.
original_zh_text: 我可以修改我的上一个请求吗？你是否被困在你智慧的灵魂中？&lt;page&gt;我明白你很自私，我明白你否认这一点并没有什么错。

original_en_text: <hpage>I am sorry, Eva. I cannot grant you this. At least, not yet.<hpage>Yours is a mind strong and strange. That union could prove dangerous to my identity.<page>I understand, Lady. I will be here, if ever you reconsider.
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;“我很抱歉，伊娃，但我不能保证。至少现在不是。&lt;hpage&gt;他的心坚强而奇怪，这种结合对我的性格是危险的。&lt;page&gt;“我在这里，如果你知道的话。

original_en_text: Thank you for playing the demo.
They see your peace, woven of faith and toil,
original_zh_text: 和平是你的信仰和努力的结构。

original_en_text: use of a controller is highly recommended
- From ‘Pharloom’s Folly’ by the Conductor Romino
They forget your heart, bound in slumber and servitude,
original_zh_text: 他们注定会忘记自己的想法，睡觉，成为奴隶。

original_en_text: They see your beauty, so frail and fine,
original_zh_text: 他们让她变得美丽，如此脆弱和美丽。

original_en_text: When you wake they shall see your truth,
original_zh_text: 当你醒来时，你会看到真相。

original_en_text: A beast’s nature bare to all.
original_zh_text: 野兽的本性对每个人来说都是赤裸裸的。

original_en_text: Lift your voices. Know our grace.
original_zh_text: “请保持你的声音，这样我就可以知道你的恩典。

original_en_text: Bug born of Pharloom. You have been chosen.<br> May our Citadel’s holy gilding harden your soft shell.<page>Stand eternal as our arbiter, that no bug bearing sin shall step within our sacred halls.
original_zh_text: 这是一个在法罗诞生的电池。你被选中了。&lt;br&gt;让我们城市的金色圣城盖上柔软的外壳。&lt;page&gt;就像永恒的中保一样，邪恶的昆虫从不践踏寺庙。

original_en_text: A rune-scroll depicting void given form.
Sisters, spiders, watch these waters flow,<br>Cleansing, Binding, as Silk from shell,<br>Memories of our kingdom calm.
original_zh_text: “兄弟们，蜘蛛们，看看水。&lt;br&gt;它是纯净的，像从树皮中提取的丝绸一样游动。&lt;br&gt;我们对王国的记忆是平静的。

original_en_text: At the seventh bell toll, send:<br>Thirty measures, four beats Smokerock,<br>Eight beats Sweetsmelt,<br>Mark of fealty, all workers.<page>At the ninth bell toll, send:<br>Twenty measures, two beats Smokerock,<br>Seven beats Sweetsmelt,<br>Mark of fealty, all workers.<page>
original_zh_text: 第七颗子弹：&lt;br&gt;30人中有4人折断了手杖。&lt;br&gt;击中八个人。&lt;br&gt;这就是对所有员工的忠诚。&lt;page&gt;第九次罢工&lt;br&gt;在20个策略中，有两个击败了斯洛克。&lt;br&gt;其中七人赢得了奖杯。&lt;br&gt;它是对每个员工忠诚的象征。&lt;page&gt;

original_en_text: When three fonts weep, our sacred shrine shall rise.
original_zh_text: 说完这三句话，寺庙就起来了。

original_en_text: Damned are we! The lingered few bound still to suffer. Cursed thrice by Pharloom, to wait, to watch, to cry our anguish.<page>No more! We say! No more! We cry! We all have wailed and wept. Fair Pharloom’s fall has come at last. Its end we now accept.
original_zh_text: 妈的，妈的！我们因跌倒而被诅咒了三次，但我们等待、观看，痛苦地哭泣。&lt;page&gt;仅此而已！我们好好谈谈！不再！他哭了！我们都哭了，我们都哭了。“农场”倒塌了。现在我们接受结局。

original_en_text: Litany of the Worker<br>May we catch the dregs and never tire,<br>May we clean the dregs and never hunger,<br>May we spool the dregs and never falter.
original_zh_text: 工作人员继续阅读。&lt;br&gt;他永远不会厌倦肮脏的东西。&lt;br&gt;清除污垢，永远不会挨饿。&lt;br&gt;我不吃灰尘也不喝酒。

original_en_text: Oath of the Whiteward<br>While song must be sung, none may falter.<br>Infirmity. Sickness. Death.<br>All are banished from our Citadel.
original_zh_text: 白色誓言&lt;br&gt;我唱歌，但没有人在乎。&lt;br&gt;病死。&lt;br&gt;他们都被赶出了城堡。

original_en_text: Penitent, Fourth of the Fourth.<br>Guilty of the sins of infirmity, sickness.<br>Penance by swallowing.<br>Absolution granted after death.<page>Penitent, Twelfth of the First.<br>Guilty of an unnamed sin.<br>Penance by casting.<br>Absolution not granted.
original_zh_text: 第四次忏悔&lt;br&gt;免受虚弱和疾病的影响。&lt;br&gt;吐出来&lt;br&gt;死后的宽恕。&lt;page&gt;忏悔，十二。&lt;br&gt;发生了一起未知的犯罪事件。&lt;br&gt;我发誓我有罪。&lt;br&gt;没有宽恕，

original_en_text: Penitent, Eighth of the Twelfth.<br>Guilty of the sin of irreverence.<br>Penance by chaining.<br>Absolution granted after death.<page>Penitent, Second of the Fourth.<br>Guilty of the sin of dissonance.<br>Penance by silencing.<br>Absolution granted after death.
original_zh_text: 12月8日认罪&lt;br&gt;对别人粗鲁是一种罪过。&lt;br&gt;我会在监狱里解释的。&lt;br&gt;死后的宽恕。&lt;page&gt;第四卷：遗憾&lt;br&gt;就像我之前说的，我不同意。&lt;br&gt;默默忏悔。&lt;br&gt;死后的宽恕

original_en_text: Remains of a Muckroach crushed by falling rock.
original_zh_text: 甲虫的身体撞在了落下的岩石上。

original_en_text: Anguished Aura<br>Eight masks hard, swirled soul enraged.<br>Twelve aknids flat, all juices strained.<page>Six pilgrims living, hung long to drain.
original_zh_text: 你会受苦的。&lt;br&gt;8他们的脸很硬，他们的心很愤怒。&lt;br&gt;收集12个痤疮坚果并过滤所有汁液。&lt;page&gt;六名朝圣者仍然活着，等待着他们的愿望。

original_en_text: A white lock bearing a surgical symbol.

original_zh_text: 这个符号代表大多数组织。

original_en_text: Their shells are ours. Their souls are ours.<br>Our hate is forever.
original_zh_text: 他们的灵魂是我们的，他们的躯壳也是我们的。&lt;br&gt;仇恨是永恒的。

original_en_text: Containment fails. Memory lost. Excise outer. Maintain inner.<br>Shellwood stasis sustained - Remember.<br>Marrowlands stasis critical - Remember.<br>Verdanian environment exceeded - Destined to forget.
original_zh_text: 避免犯错误。记忆丧失从外部消除。我还在家里。&lt;br&gt;树皮和树木的停滞仍在继续。&lt;br&gt;严重的骨髓骤停-记住。&lt;br&gt;除了令人印象深刻的氛围之外，注定会被遗忘。

original_en_text: Here is established, by holy consent of the Conductors,<br>The Memorium of Pharloom.<br><br>What Is Remembered Is Never Lost.
original_zh_text: 经司机同意，&lt;br&gt;Farroom Memorial附近酒店&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;记忆永远不会消失。

original_en_text: A rune depicting paths away from Pharloom.
original_zh_text: 罗恩免除了他的负罪感。

original_en_text: Due to unacceptably high injury and unsanctioned deaths, Ventrica travel shall henceforth be denied to all.<br> For Pharloom eternal, a bug who serves must never die.
original_zh_text: 由于伤亡人数不可接受，前往马达加斯加的旅行将被禁止。&lt;br&gt;在Lighthouse中，持续的服务错误不会消失。

original_en_text: Pilgrim<br>Spare a song for those who lay here silent.<br>By strength abandoned, they fell before the final ascent.
original_zh_text: 关于飞行员。&lt;br&gt;给沉默的人留下一首歌。&lt;br&gt;他们失去了力量，在进行最后一次攀登之前摔倒了。

original_en_text: <hpage>I understand now... The steel child’s servant grew bold...<hpage>I know what the fleeing bug seeks to call, and their etchings here suggest clear clues to where. <hpage>What they attempt is dangerous, stupid. It can only end badly. I must hurry if I’m to stop this.
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;现在，我知道家里的男孩们都变得勇敢了。&lt;hpage&gt;这就是所谓的“逃跑的昆虫”，这项工作给了我们明确的线索。&lt;hpage&gt;他们的努力是危险且无用的。结果很糟糕。如果你想阻止它，你就得快点。

original_en_text: An old rune displaying the design for a Weaver weapon.
original_zh_text: 带有底盘设计的老式赛车。

original_en_text: Sister, spider, sat between salt and stone,<br>Build those tools of brilliant mind imagined,<br>Aid us when our Silk has waned.
original_zh_text: 姐妹俩在盐和石头之间爬行。&lt;br&gt;虚拟大脑工具&lt;br&gt;如果丝绸脱落，请帮助我。

original_en_text: An old stone gate with a simple keyhole.
original_zh_text: 一座古老的塔门，开口简单。

original_en_text: Sister, spider, husk bound to branch,<br>Watch over these bugs, passing safe,<br>Warded by fear,<br>No longer your meal.
original_zh_text: 姐妹、蜘蛛、树枝上的贝壳，&lt;br&gt;为了认识到这些错误并自信地克服它们，&lt;br&gt;接受他们的恐惧，&lt;br&gt;这不再是你的食物。

original_en_text: Bug born of Pharloom. You have been chosen.<br> May our Citadel’s holy gilding harden your soft shell.<page>Stand eternal as our arbiter, that no bug bearing sin shall ever step within our sacred halls.
original_zh_text: 这是一个在法罗诞生的电池。你被选中了。&lt;br&gt;让我们城市的金色圣城盖上柔软的外壳。&lt;page&gt;就像我们的法官一样，我们总是在寺庙里，没有虫子，没有罪恶。

original_en_text: I have departed to pay my respects at the graves within the great wood.<br>- Pinmaster Plinney
original_zh_text: 我在树林里看到一个坟墓。&lt;br&gt;本斯·普林尼

original_en_text: Penitent, First of the First.<br>Guilty of the sin of apostasy.<br>Penance by constriction.<br>Absolution denied.
original_zh_text: 首先是忏悔者。&lt;br&gt;罪恶的不服从，&lt;br&gt;了解界限。&lt;br&gt;宽恕就是否认。

original_en_text: Weaver, in eighth part, last of their line, frail with age.<br>Tracked and taken in Sandsea Waste.<br>Seven Choristors, nine Envoys lost to task.
original_zh_text: 韦弗是家里的最后一个成员，随着年龄的增长，他变得越来越虚弱。&lt;br&gt;桑迪溪荒野旧金山&lt;br&gt;七诫和九使徒失败了。

original_en_text: Cloth and materials that could be fashioned into additional pockets.
original_zh_text: 面料和材料可以让口袋变得额外。

original_en_text: Sister, spider, husk bound to moss,<br>Watch over these bugs born low,<br>Raised up by fervour fostered,<br>Born and caught within our web unknowing.
original_zh_text: 姐妹、蜘蛛、贝壳，绑在苔藓上，&lt;br&gt;小心昆虫。&lt;br&gt;充满激情成长&lt;br&gt;我们生来就无意识，被困在网里。

original_en_text: Sister, spider, if seeking commune with the creature atop this mount, take the climb above as test, a challenge beyond even our setting.<page>Upon that summit gained, and creature hailed, know it shall choose what gift to grant, with death as likely as insight.
original_zh_text: 如果您想与您的姐妹、蜘蛛和这些山地生物交流，请尝试上面的生物。&lt;page&gt;当它达到顶峰时，生物会感到快乐，知道该赠送什么礼物，通过感知，死亡成为可能。

original_en_text: Hate for their light. Hate for their pins. For their waste poured thick and endless.<page>Fill your hearts with hate, for power has now been claimed, and with it we shall punish.
original_zh_text: 我不喜欢灯，我讨厌别针，它们的屎总是会冒出来。&lt;page&gt;一颗充满仇恨的心。因为权力是私人的，我们惩罚了他们。

original_en_text: Here we honour the seed that sprung the wood. <page>By her grace may all bugs pass safe to join us and our song.
original_zh_text: 我们来这里是为了向我们播种的种子致敬。&lt;page&gt;我们感谢大家的善意，并希望所有昆虫都能安全返回加入我们的音乐。

original_en_text: Daughter of a distant land...<br>We who remained have waited long...<br>Bind our strength to yours...<br>Reclaim the future of our haunted kingdom...
original_zh_text: 遥远国家的女儿&lt;br&gt;这里的人们已经等了很长时间了。&lt;br&gt;增强我们和你们的力量。&lt;br&gt;重建幽灵王国的未来。

original_en_text: If the haunted continue their work, leave them be! Only those who frustrate production shall be removed.
original_zh_text: 如果鬼魂还在工作，就让它走吧！消除生产中断。

original_en_text: An inert automaton with an empty chest.

On the eighth harvest, send:<br>Fifty measures, nine beats dregthread, spooled,<br>Fourteen measures dregthread, twined,<br>Oath of fealty, all workers.<page>On the twelfth harvest, send:<br>Forty measures dregthread, spooled,<br>Two beats fine thread, twined,<br>Oath of fealty, all workers.<page>
original_zh_text: 如果这是第八次收获，请发送：&lt;br&gt;Thread Dregg 50 Bar，9小时&lt;br&gt;第十四条贩毒&lt;br&gt;他们都很忠诚。&lt;page&gt;在第12集中，请发送以下信息：&lt;br&gt;带有40根测量线、线圈&lt;br&gt;有两行，&lt;br&gt;我们的员工都宣誓忠诚。&lt;page&gt;

original_en_text: In the air. The water. Everywhere.<br>Inside their shells. Twisted inside. Guts.<page>Tightest around heart. Pulsing rhythm.<br>Sick. Alive. Dead?<br>Something worse.<page>Deeper. Must look deeper.
original_zh_text: 空气中到处都是水。&lt;br&gt;丝绸的。他的心正在改变。价值，价值&lt;page&gt;斑疹伤寒就在你的心头。&lt;br&gt;他是病了还是死了？&lt;br&gt;不好意思&lt;page&gt;需要进行彻底的调查。

original_en_text: A bucket overflowing with smouldering Flintstone.
Pilgrim<br>This settlement welcomes all who step the holy path.<br>May you ease your shell within, that your strength renewed can carry you higher.
original_zh_text: 关于飞行员。&lt;br&gt;我们欢迎所有追随上帝道路的人。&lt;br&gt;让你的心休息一下，你的新力量会让你达到更高的高度。

original_en_text: Weaver of Pharloom.<br>By grace you warded. By thread you healed.<br>For your favour, eternal, we offer our song.
original_zh_text: 光明之酒&lt;br&gt;愿上帝保佑你并治愈你。&lt;br&gt;为了你的爱和永恒，我们为你歌唱。

original_en_text: A crude map of the Underworks.

original_zh_text: 这是一个古老的监管体系。

original_en_text: O, great land whose flame doth falter!<br>Whose choir, conductors, all doth fail,<page>Observe! Take heart! That spark still burning,<br>Yon butterfly of crimson grace,<page>All bells shall peal, and voices raise,<br>When brave Trobbio steps, at last, upon the stage!
original_zh_text: 大地啊，降低你的火！&lt;br&gt;船长和指挥官都失败了。&lt;page&gt;看着我！把手放在我身上！火焰仍在燃烧。&lt;br&gt;深红色蝴蝶。&lt;page&gt;每一个钟声都响，每一个声音都响。&lt;br&gt;终于，舞台上有了勇敢的奖杯！

original_en_text: Erase our fear,<br>Eliminate our desire,<page>To suffer no more,<br>Void, cleanse us.
original_zh_text: 他们的恐惧与日俱增。&lt;br&gt;为了摆脱欲望，&lt;page&gt;为了停止疼痛。&lt;br&gt;吸尘器清洁。

original_en_text: I have departed to scale Pharloom’s frigid mount. If any bug exists brave enough to match my pin’s fatal resolve, then climb and face me upon its stormward side.<br>- Pinstress
original_zh_text: 我开始爬向冰山的灯塔，如果一只昆虫决定与我的命运相匹配，我就会爬到暴风雨中的某个地方，它们就会面对我。&lt;br&gt;“公主，公主！

original_en_text: Flickering Flame<br>Five masks swirled soul, brought and broiled.<br>Four stones rage-baked, crushed powder coarse.<page>Three shells fresh from pilgrims fallen, to contain and age.
original_zh_text: “火之闪电”&lt;br&gt;五个可以旋转和佩戴来燃烧灵魂的面具。&lt;br&gt;他会烧毁你的石头，碾碎你的灰尘。&lt;page&gt;刚刚从朝圣者手中掉落的三枚炮弹被密封并倒塌。

original_en_text: Weaver, in eighth part, last of their line, mortally wounded.<br>Tracked and taken in the Blackbarrens.<br>Four Choristors, one Reed lost to task.
original_zh_text: 韦弗在第八轮结束时受了致命伤。&lt;br&gt;黑画面&lt;br&gt;包括里德在内的四名指挥官因公殉职。

original_en_text: A machine displaying a model of the Citadel.

<hpage>The second spot marked by the child of steel. This camp too was used by their vassal, and another rite was conducted here, this one incomplete. <hpage>The action was clearly taken in haste. Did they believe themself pursued? The etchings here are crude, but the words are disturbing... and desperate.
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;人们还利用这块田地进行另一种仪式，但这次没有完成。&lt;hpage&gt;你认为他们会受到迫害吗？这里的切割很粗糙，但那里却很不舒服。

original_en_text: Cloth and incendiary materials that could be fashioned into an explosive weapon.
original_zh_text: 可用作爆炸性武器的衣服和火焰室

original_en_text: Shellplates and cogs that could be fashioned into a flying automaton.
original_zh_text: 我们可以用药物和设备来制造飞行机器人。

original_en_text: In silence your voice,<br>In darkness your form,<page>We higher who see you seeking,<br>Our shells yearn for your embrace.
original_zh_text: 灵魂的沉默，&lt;br&gt;在黑暗中，以它的形式，&lt;page&gt;当一个伟人看到你时，&lt;br&gt;我在你怀里很饿。

original_en_text: -ilgrim<br>You who have held tight to faith have been carried far.<br>This station shall offer brief rest to those devout.
original_zh_text: 英语&lt;br&gt;我认为她被绑架了。&lt;br&gt;这个地方为虔诚的人提供了一些休息的地方。

original_en_text: Half-spawn of a distant land...<br>Within this cage I have waited...<br>Let my strength be bound to yours...<br>Reclaim the future of our accursed kingdom...
original_zh_text: 其中一半来自偏远地区。&lt;br&gt;在笼子里等着。&lt;br&gt;用我的力量和你的力量&lt;br&gt;恢复被诅咒王国的未来。

original_en_text: Child, I have answered the call to climb. I rise to join our elders in that holy place far above. May you, in time, grow strong enough to meet us there.
original_zh_text: 我被邀请去爬山。我站起来，和长辈们一起去了遥远的避难所。坚强起来，加入我们！

original_en_text: An old map of the Putrified Ducts.
This low, her gaze escaped.<br>Prepare, sisters. Weave hope anew.<br>That we might break free this accursed web born of our naive foundation.
original_zh_text: 她很矮，眼睛也很迟钝。&lt;br&gt;兄弟姐妹们，准备好重建希望。&lt;br&gt;您可以从纯粹诞生的被诅咒的网络中解放出来。

original_en_text: An ornate door closed with a simple lock.
original_zh_text: 门被一把简单的锁紧紧地锁着。

original_en_text: Pilgrim<br>Accept the judgment of the rise beyond,<br>That all who stand at Pharloom’s holy crest prove pure of will and want.
original_zh_text: 关于飞行员。&lt;br&gt;接受超越崛起的判断。&lt;br&gt;任何戴着罪恶王冠的人都是纯粹的意志和欲望。

original_en_text: Two children born entwined, apart,<br>Two children marked to rule,<page>They danced, they sang, proved blades beyond,<br>But none forgot their birth,<br>For lovers born on beat exact shall be forever cursed.
original_zh_text: 两个孩子出生时就有联系。&lt;br&gt;两名未成年人都有罪。&lt;page&gt;他们又舞又唱，以证明喇嘛就在那里。&lt;br&gt;没有人会忘记他的出生。&lt;br&gt;对于一个天生就有节奏的人来说，准确性永远是一个诅咒。

original_en_text: Great bugs! You who weep as your kingdom fades,<br>join me upon the Stage.<br> Together, we shall enflame the passion of Pharloom!
original_zh_text: 错误！你的王国会崩溃，你会哭泣。&lt;br&gt;请和我一起上台。&lt;br&gt;让我们分享您对灯塔的热情！

original_en_text: <hpage>This location was marked by the steel child. This camp is old, but still shows clear evidence of an attempt at a rite.<hpage>Whatever the vassal hoped to achieve here seems to have failed. The other marked locations may provide more clues to its intent.
original_zh_text: &lt;hpage&gt;该营地很古老，但有明显的证据表明有人试图举行仪式。&lt;hpage&gt;我所希望的一切都失败了。其他星座的位置会给你暗示你的意图。

original_en_text: Weaver, in quarter part, last of their line, staked to service.<br>Tracked and taken beneath the City of Steel.<br>Eight Choristors, twelve Envoys lost to task.
original_zh_text: 第四名（韦伯）发球最后一排。&lt;br&gt;铁城的照片。&lt;br&gt;12个环中，8个环未能完成任务。

original_en_text: By our Citadel’s glory, you treasured devout may bask brief in its holy light.
original_zh_text: 让您神圣的人民沐浴在您的光芒中，闪耀着我们宝贵城市的荣耀。

original_en_text: A husk with a map of the Slab etched upon its shell.
original_zh_text: 你会发现里面有一张纸。
